But, I guess they don't need much more space then they have. No seating in or outside of the bakery so keep that in mind it's a grab and go place. You can get a box of 6 pastries for roughly $25 and it's completely worth it. Also note that the famous cruffins (croissant/muffins) are not served until later in the morning. I got there right when it opened and there was no line luckily but I was informed that the cruffins aren't ready until 10 or 11 each day. I was bummed at first but I got my box of 6 other delicacies (flavors change daily) and I was NOT disappointed. The salted chocolate chip cookie was to DIE for. I also got a caramel bun thing, a donut, a croissant, a strawberry jalapeño brioche bun, and Kouimg Aman. Definitely make the trip to nob hill to try this place
author: Darin T.

description:
I've been coming to this place since the soft launch, and I gotta say everything is just fantastic. 

Cruffins are amazing, brioche is top-notch, the amelie amann is a flaky piece of heaven. 

Only caveat: GET THERE EARLY! Seriously, they sell out of most stuff by noon. This place is that good.
author: Devin O.

description:
I arrived to Mr.Holmes at 10:00am on a Thursday, after a couple minutes in line I asked the gentleman taking my order what he recommended, he replied, "The cruffins, but we are already sold out." So I requested a pistachio pastry for myself, and 2 of the doughnuts with cream and a vile of juice coming out for each of my children.

Turns out the doughnut that I got my kids is called a negroni and the vile of "juice" was actually alcohol. Aside from my children not being able to eat it, my sister and I agreed the doughnut was especially disgusting. The pistachio pastry was good but not worth going to the tenderloin to get again.

Im not particularly happy that the employees failed to mention the negroni doughnut was literally equipped with a shot as I ordered it with two small children by my side. Im also unsure why they would give me one recommendation and it be something they are sold out of.
author: Alex H.

description:
Pros: everything is daaalicious. It's close to my work
Cons: everything is daaalicious. It's way too close to my work. 

Seriously. Everything is good. No complaints. It may be a little pricey but what do you expect from an up and coming bakery in downtown SF. Long lines? Yes. So what? It's definitely worth it. Good luck just trying to order only one or two items. You know you want the box for your FB / IG post. It'll most definitely get you at least 50 likes
author: Bermel L.

description:
Ridiculously good donuts, croistants, cruffins, and other baked yummies. 

But also very pricey. 3.50 for a donut is too high. 

Extra points for opening up on Larkin btwn Sutter and Post. This neck of the woods is poised for an awakening.
author: Christian A.

description: Nothing bad to ever say about this place, I live around the corner and it's a treat, the menu kind of rotates or is seasonal I'm not sure which but I've never had something I didn't like there  terrible for my diet but it's so good can't help myself. Staff is always nice / and quick too!
author: Sabina T.

description: WTF. YUM!!!! I'm glad I'm too busy to line up for this most days....or I would be in trouble!
author: Tara S.

description: I got to Mr. Holmes bakehouse a around 10:30 on a Wednesday morning and it was packed with a line headed out the door! Unfortunately with my timing everything was on it's way to being sold out but I managed to get my hands on a perfectly moist delicious slice of lemon almond poppyseed cake, it was to die for. Looking forward to trying it again with more options!
author: Olivia T.

description:
This is NOT for the cruffins. I didn't get one. I'm too lazy to get up and wait.

However, the other baked goods are very delicious. 
My favorite was the salted caramel donut. The donut was fluffy and there was just enough cream in there - not overly filled like your standard dunkin donuts.
Croissant and chocolate croissants are both flakey and rich, but not overly buttered. A little light on the chocolate in the chocolate croissant but honestly, I prefer croissants without the chocolate so I was okay with it.
Almond brioche - thick buttery toast with almonds. Extremely rich.

Not my favorites:
Amelie aman: Too tough/crusty on the outside and hard to eat.
Apple tart: Tasted good but like a standard apple tart - nothing extraordinary (full disclosure: had this two days later so it might have been better the day of)

Is it worth the wait (even for the normal baked goods)? Maybe. I'm not quite convinced. Ah well, at least I got to try this place and check it off my list :P.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
I just watched the guy in front of me snag the last cruffin at 9:36 AM on a Monday. REALLY? REALLY GUY?? 

We just drove an hour and a half to this damn place for ONE thing. And he's with his friend who also ordered a cruffin. Apparently sharing isn't their thing. 

The reason why this is getting an alright review (because who can't supply their own hyped up store??) is because the girl who was helping us was super apologetic and gave us some great recommendations though I'll admit, I just wanted to leave-I was SO disappointed.

We went with the blueberry and white chocolate Danish and some sugary toffee construction with a weird name I don't remember. 

Blueberries were fresh and that was the only thing I enjoyed. The other one was way too sugary sweet and was covered with so much baked-on sugar that it was almost difficult to bite. Not my thing. 

I came in knowing what I wanted. Sadly, this place does not supply enough for their overwhelming (albeit hyped up and novelty) demand.
author: Kaitlin G.

description:
This place has a killer business plan. You must get in a separate line to get a cruffin, which don't begin to sell until 9am, you can't order more than 2 cruffins, and once they sell out (by around 10am), they close shop. 

Also, the flavors of the donuts and cruffins, amongst other pastries change every day. One day you got chocolate banana, and the next you got matcha. So really, when you go there once, you don't even have half of the experience finished! 

I definitely recommend going on a week day, as the line only took about 30 minutes, and I got there at 8:40am. You can also get a nicely designed box for your pastries (for $1 something) but if you get 6 pastries or more the box is free. 

Overall, my experience here was nice (and a little messy!) I would definitely give it another wait for a matcha donut if I am nearby that early in the morning!
author: Stevie G.

description: Best bakery in SF. Cruffins are the best. I think that this means creamy+ muffins = cruffins, because they are. So every day is a fresh cruffin flavor. Every day is a different flavor. There is often a long line to get in to order the cruffins and they sell out every morning. Postmates will often wait in line for you if you order it on their app.
author: Marie A.

description: Really good pastries, but quantities are very limited so get there early.  We arrived on Memorial Day late morning and scored the last two kouign amann for the day.  I felt bad for the 10 or so people still in line who were turned away.  Will definitely plan to come earlier to see what else they have.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I thought it was okay. Pretty good, but not great. 

They were out of cruffins, so I can't comment on those. 

We stood in line about 20 minutes (on a Tuesday around 9:30am). I felt really weird about standing in line in the Tenderloin, surrounded by so much poverty and sadness, to sample the latest hipster bakery. : /
We tried 5 items, plus coffee (Sightglass). Everything looked beautiful, but we weren't too impressed with the flavors. The plain butter croissants had some sort of sweetness brushed on the outer layer which was disappointing. 
Cute place, but not worth the wait and expensive prices. I'll stick with Tartine, Sandbox, and others.
author: Joyce G.

description: Hands down the best donuts on the west coast! I have done some custom orders with them too, and the manager Bridget is so great to work with, they have great baked goodies, and equally great customer service!!! 5 star all the way.
author: Seerat S.

description: This place is worth the wait. Not sure if i've ever devoured a pastry that fast. Love their changing menu!
author: Alea H.

description: If you haven't tried the cruffins yet, you are missing out! If you thought cronuts were phenomenal then wait till you have a cruffin! Yeah I spend about $30 for 7 pastries at Mr. Holmes but they're worth every penny. Make sure to get there around 8, 8:30 to get a cruffin because they go fast. Side note, cruffins line opens at 9am. The bread pudding is to die for as well as the bostock. Just delicious.
author: Sonia R.

description:
I loved the beta testing concept. I probably wouldn't have ever gone out of my way to go here had I not tried the goodies that day. I don't live in SF so i try to stay away from this area...(it's very hectic to me). However, i will brave the chaos to get to these pastries!  .

HOLY COW! Everything was exquisite! The donuts were perfectly balanced with sweetness. The croissants were also very good, flaky and buttery yum!

I suggest getting there early, i went on opening day at about 10am and they were already sold out of a lot of stuff. I'm guessing it'll be like that for a while since they just opened. 

The staff was super nice and helpful...I hope they keep that up. My bi-weekly trips to SF now have a new addition :)
author: Gina G.

description:
I love desserts. I gave the fluffernutter Cruffin a try. It's not my dessert of choice. I like the execution of the filling with the soft layers of the croissant but the crunchy outside texture wasn't appealing to me. I'm just happy the filling wasn't too sweet.

But hey the "I Got Baked in San Francisco" neon sign is cool.
author: Precious C.

description:
Can't believe I'm going to give a five star review to a place packed with this many hipsters,  but I guess everyone is right once in a while. 

Cruffin, twice baked croissant,  etc. You've heard it all a thousand times by now. It's all great. Get up early,  endure the queue,  and get an assortment of whatever they have left.
author: Victoria W.

description: One time I went there they had this "California roll croissant" or something.  It had nori and salmon. It didn't sound like it would be as delicious as it was - it was even served with soy sauce.  But oh my god.
author: Gautam J.

description: Delicious savory goods! I always miss out on the cruffins b/c I can't get out of bed that early and don't care to wait in line. Someday...I can see they are worth it.
author: Jason G.

description: I was here at San Francisco for the weekend and thought I'd try this place due to all the hype on Instagram.  My boyfriend and I arrived at the location at 7:30 hoping to get an infamous cruffin when they opened at 8:00am.  The bakery opens at 8:00 but the cruffins wouldn't be sold until 9:00. On the windows were two different signs, a sign to line up for donuts and a sign to line up for cruffins.  We lined up for the cruffins because they were more popular.  Since there was two of us, they had a special Matcha filled donut that day so I went to that line and got me some donuts while my boyfriend waited in the cruffin line. Then at 9:00 the cruffins were brought out.  Wow, it was like waiting to get a glimpse of the queen. HAHA! It was quite exciting being the first and everyone was flashing photos trying to get a shot of the ooey goodness. I don't like being in people's photos so in that sence I was quite unfortunate. Well, when we got our donuts and cruffins it was taste time.  The cruffins were good.  Just what I expected.  Tasted just like a sugary flaky croissant with chocolate carmel filling shaped like a pretty muffin.  Probably not worth the 1.5 hour wait.  Then it was time to taste the green tea match filled donut.  That in my opinion was better than the cruffin.  Donut was sweet due to the sprinkled sugar but the dough tasted light and not heavy at all.  I don't like alot of filling but it was generously filled. Would I come back again? Sure, probably for the donuts.
author: Chanie S.

description: You know something is good when you have to lick the crumbs off the plate.  The California croissant was intriguing.  Very flaky and crispy croissant with sprinkles of black and white sesame seeds.  Curled inside was seaweed, salmon, and tiny bit of wasabi.  I asked why include soy sauce?  I didn't need it.  The salmon, was it smoked? It was a bit salty.  This reminds me of sushi roll the flaky croissant stands in for the rice.  I should count how many "flaky" word I use in this review.  I was blessed to go inside and found the place empty, literally empty of people and empty of any baked goods.  There were only 5 items left.  What the heck, I got the California croissant.  I was told that if I wait 10 minutes "something something" would come out of the oven.   I kept on asking over and over what was coming out since I didn't catch the name.  Why is it, all the nice baked items have really hard names to remember?  The person at the counter was very patient and nice to explain.  Unfortunately, all I remembered was passion fruit and custard.  I prepaid and left.  When I got back there were people waiting inside and next thing you know a line formed behind me.  I didn't know I was so popular?  Not really, they were there for the goods.  Whatever it is I got, it was delicious and flaky.  The passion fruit jam was very flavorful.  I understand now why they run out of items.  It's too delicious not to get a few and spread the love of these delicious items.  I saw a bag of ginger in the kitchen.  It would be wonderful to go back and see what creations come out of those.  Merry Christmas everyone.
author: Helen L.

description: Closed 20 minutes early. That's ridiculously annoying when you walk this far across town with a friend with a stroller.
author: Anna S.

description: Stood in line for 45 minutes just to get in and find out all they had left was cookies. I realize they run out (athough knowing that, they should make more!) but the least the could do is send someone out to tell the 50 people who are all waiting for cruffins that they are sold out! So rude and disappointing. I won't be back
author: libby a.

description: All the baked treats are really good. I still want to try the matcha donut and matcha cruffin but sometimes the line can be super long and you end up with no cruffins :( Wish they were open later.
author: Sandra S.

description: Another great purchase! I swear I'm in love with the turkey pepper savory pastry. Every flavor stands out, nothing outdoes the other, and the crispness is amazing. I don't think I could ever grow tired of it. I also added three California croissants because, let's be real, those are bomb digs. I can always count on Mr. Holmes Bakehouse to satisfy my cravings, savory or sweet, and I fall in love every time. Highly, HIGHLY recommend to all my morning people!
author: Tricia M.

description: If you like waiting in long lines to get decent pastries in an area with ridiculous street parking, only to find out that all the cruffins are gone by 11 AM .. and that there will be no more, then please do swing by. Why can't you guys just bake more than 10 cruffins per day?
author: Thalia H.

description: Absolutely delicious cruffins!! They are versions of croissants filled with various mousses. Very very similar to morning buns. I have not tried anything else but heard great things about the other baked goods too.
author: Charmaine L.

description: This is the one of the bakeries that I've been to. I had the Chocolate stout cruffin and it's so delicious. I can't wait to go back again real soon..
author: Dear J.

description:
Everything was so wonderful here! We were fortunate enough that we stayed right around the corner from here and accidentally stumbled across this bakehouse. We went there 3 of the 4 mornings that we were in town. First time there, we arrived around 10:30, only to find out they already sold out of the cruffins!! We had to go back the second day to get our fix.....this time, arriving at 8:45.  Luckily since it was a weekday, the wait was only about 15-20 minutes. We got the triple chocolate cruffins and they were divine! The bread pudding and savory danish were also very delicious!

Our families enjoyed the pictures that we posted so much that they begged us to bring some back to Dallas. Unfortunately....we were only able to bring back 4 since there is a 2 per person limit! 

I would highly recommend this place.....it's well worth the wait!
author: D N.

description: Came here to try cruffins.  We got in line around 9:30 on a Monday morning and got our cruffins at ~9:45.  They ran out shortly after us, while we were paying.  But they were delicious, along with the other few things we tried!!  I wish they had more coffee selection since they only sell one kind of drip coffee, or maybe other breakfasty drinks.
author: Jenny C.

description: Best croissants in the city!! I rarely visit this place because it's far from my apartment but when I go to lower nob hill I always stop in. Plus their selection changes day to day so you will never get tired of the same old stuff.
author: Emily L.

description: Came in to get a cruffin before I headed over to run errands. The line wasn't unbearable and went by quick with a few rounds of Angry Birds. The flavor of the day was chocolate chestnut (yum!) and you are limited to two cruffins per person. The other pastries are good, especially the kouign amann and the ube pastry. You can even get a nice picture for instagram next to the brightly lit sign. Once I bit into the cruffin, it was nice and airy and filled with some type of cream which was DELICIOUS. Kind of expensive for pastries though, I spent a good $30 for a box of 7 pastries. Yikes! But I think they're worth it. When I'm craving something sweet and am in the area, I will come here to satisfy my sweet tooth.
author: Taylor H.

description: It's Sunday and we woke up late.  But my husband surprised me with an impromptu drive into the city to head to the bakery I've been dying to try for some time.  I knew the lines would either be too long or the highly anticipated cruffins would be sold out.  When we got there, there were no cruffins in sight.  We got a box of everything to try and I dove right into the brioche with raspberries.  The outer crust was just the right amount of crunchy and oh lord, when you bite into the middle, the bread is so light and buttery ~ yes, Pastry Heaven. Cannot wait to head back on an earlier morning to try the cruffins.  I do my best to not buy into what's new simply because it's new but this place?  Definitely worth the hype.  I'll get "baked" here anytime.
author: Joy H.

description:
This place needs to franchise and come east. 

Cruffins and coffee for 3 days, there is no better start to any morning.  Bringing  pastries to our morning meetings also meant that I was the star of the show, for a few minutes anyway.
author: Panas S.

description: This place is cute. The pastries are really good. They always seem to be out of Cruffins though, and that's whack. The Brioche Donuts always have good fillings though.
author: Kameelah R.

description:
Out of cruffins, but what they did have was awesome!

Amazing pastries and donuts.  I'm so glad I was able to find parking fairly nearby, and that they still had an assortment of items.  The donut I had was filled with a delicious mango cream.  One of the other pastries had mango and coconut on top of a pastry dough shell.  Everything I purchased was fabulous.  Reason for 4 stars, is that I felt they should come up with a way to bake more cruffins.   Items were $4.50 each, a bit on the high side.
author: Judy K.

description: The absolute best CRUFFIN!!!! I normally get annoyed to wait in line for pretty much anything, oh but not for some CRUFFIN! It was definitely worth the wait. Seems to get crowded but you can do what I did and just enjoyed it while strolling down downtown! I need to go back and buy a dozen
author: Edith R.

description: I honestly only came here to take a picture with the 1975 esque wall background. I ended up buying $35 worth of goodies. I waited in the line for about 20 minutes at noon time. The box is super aesthetic as well. We walked around with the box in our hands and people thought we were carrying around something classified. Next time I'm back in SF, I'm most definitely going to stop by here again.
author: Brandon L.

description: Yum yum yum! Cruffins r the bomb! Everything is sooo good. Only downside is the line and how fast they sell out. Customer service us great.  Everything is fresh n tasty. I loove the ferrero roche thingy. Its suuuper yummy n their donuts taste like malasadas. This is a must try but get there early they sell out quick
author: Melissa K.

description:
OMG sugar.
Unfortunately, we didn't get to try the cruffins because they ran out right before we could make it through the line - we were next in line too! :( Minus one star because they ran out of cruffins at 9:30am and they don't even come out of the oven until 9am, so running out of something within 30 mins seems inefficient. You would think that with something so in demand, they would increase their supply enough to at least last until 10am, but I guess it's a tactic to increase the hype. 

However, everything else was SO GOOD. 

Vanilla cream donut - I'm not usually a fan of donuts, but this one was excellent! Crispy, sugary exterior with a fluffy, doughy interior and then the creamy vanilla custard inside. It had the most divine, authentic vanilla bean flavor and I could actually see the vanilla seeds which means they use real vanilla bean! 

Salted caramel donut - Same delicious dough as the vanilla cream donut, but the salted caramel filling was too much for me (not much of a caramel fan) but my boyfriend loved this donut! Plenty of filling too. 

Artichoke and cheese pastry - yum! Just a really good savory pastry. Plenty of huge artichoke chunks and different types of cheeses. 

Sushi croissant - was curious to try this one and it was actually really interesting and delicious! Basically a california roll but instead of rice as the carb, you have flakey, buttery croissant. A definite winner. 

Choux bomb - loved the hazelnut chocolate filling, if you love nutella, you will love this. Very, very sweet though, so I kind of regret ordering 2 because 1 was more than enough.  

Only $23 for 6 baked goods is actually a pretty good deal considering the quality and freshness of the ingredients used, we were expecting to pay a lot more so we were pleasantly surprised.
author: Paige M.

description:
The California croissant is magical. It's basically a sushi croissant. 
Salmon, ginger, wasabi, seaweed, sesame seeds on top. Dip it in the provided soy sauce and all the flavors come together in an unexpectedly delicious way. It's a little on the high side as far as price goes, but entirely reasonable considering there's salmon in it. Also it's f-ing delicious.

I'm officially a Saturday morning regular.

Edit: I tried their cheesecake doughnut. It was glorious. Literally the best doughnut I've had in my life.
author: Lydia S.

description:
Make sure you get in line early around 8AM or good luck trying to get a cruffin. I did not get the change to try the cruffin but I did have an amazing donut with vanilla custard filling that was delicious! There were many tasty looking treats that I did not get to try but will be back to try them all. The staff is also very friendly and helpful with great tips on what to do with salted caramel fudge.

I would recommend to try!
author: Elliot T.

description: I have a special place in my hear for the salted caramel donuts.
author: Jimmy U.

description: The cruffins are off the hook! I came in around 10 on a weekday morning, no line, plenty of cruffins on display.  Got 2 raspberry cruffins and 4 other items I can't really remember because the cruffins were that good!  Only knock is that the spot is tiny and the restroom is right in the waiting area and parking is a b
author: Stanley W.

description: Amazing I have never seen or heard of the creations these guys are making. Always a treat.
author: Jade G.

description:
Walked past this place on a Sunday morning and the line was crazy - like, super-duper hipster "you haaaaaave to try this" crazy. So I went and did normal things like adults who can't wait in line for two hours do, and on my way home saw the line was significantly down. The Yelp consensus was that it was great, so I got in line and was treated to a big fat heaping helping of hipster service. Thank you for disregarding my question to go back to joking with another employee! Thanks again for disregarding another question about your pastries so you could say something to somebody else who has already been helped! And thanks especially for, after I made my selection, holding my money and waving it around while you keep having a conversation with somebody else instead of getting my change! 

All of this could probably be forgiven if the pastries were amazing, like the gorgeous woman who is terrible to waiters but you put up with it because she's hot - but these pastries were sub-par at best. I've had better out of a box bought at Safeway for a sad work "treat." We didn't even finish anything we bought because it wasn't worth the calories. 

Supposedly they make something called a Cruffin that is great, but I will never know because I'm not standing in line for two hours to get treated like garbage to get another mediocre pastry.
author: Drew H.

description: This review just for the cashier lady todat wed july tye 20th at 11:00 am. Super rude and nasty attitude.!!! It sad that good bakery will ruin by employee who hate their job so much and treat the customer so poorly.
author: nita d.

description: I think I expected a bigger place, but I definitely liked the feel of it- you walk in, pick what you want from the display cases, and voila, its that easy. The pastries were delicious and the coffee was decent but the staff was not friendly or helpful at all, I was a little put off by the two girls helping me. We had never been there before and they made us feel like we were annoying them by not knowing exactly what to do.
author: Angel H.

description:
This place has definitely been discovered!

They always sell out on the weekends now, so make sure to come early to avoid disappointment.
author: Yan L.

description:
Confused. To say the least...

Maybe I'm not hipster enough, but I don't understand why people love in this place, or, at the least, brave waiting outside in the shadiest neighborhood in San Francisco for some baked goods. If you're here to get something that is Instagram-worthy, I'm sure you'll find it, amid all the different colors of baked goods, the gold-lined Mr. Holmes box, or the neon "Got Baked in San Francisco" sign...

But in terms of baked goods, I don't understand the hype. Sure, their cruffins are good, but are they worth waiting forever for? And in order to get one of those hype boxes, you have to get at least six pastries, so you'll get two cruffins, max, and four...not so good things. Everything else is pretty much color and hype - the ube donuts taste like regular donuts with color, the bread pudding isn't better than a regular bread pudding, the croissants are average.

In short: pay for cruffins, gold box, neon sign, Instagram hype. Everything else? Colored average.
author: Bobby W.

description: Get there early or all will be gone in a poof! Favorites are caramel covered croissants, cruffins, and donuts flavored in vanilla lavender. Skip your diet for the day and enjoy some delicious pastries from this place.
author: J. K.

description: They don't start serving Cruffins until 9. I got there at 830 and there was already a line specifically for Cruffins.  I had a lemon raspberry one and it most certainly lived up to all the hype!
author: Glenna W.

description: Little did I know that this place closes at 2:30 and ended up spending 25 dollars on cab fare to get back to my apartment
author: Courtney K.

description: Meh. Way too pricey for some okay donuts and pastries. I have yet to come back and try the cruffin but until then this place is overhyped. Their Kouign amann pastry was just too underwhelming.
author: Amanda H.

description: one word. CRUFFINS!! what is it? it's as if a croissant and a muffin that had a baby together. pure genius whoever came up with this new "in" thing. looks exactly like a muffin that is is crisp and fluffy layered inside. bomb!
author: Sophia N.

description: Everything is amazing! A little pricey but one of my favorite treats! Go for the cruffins and stay for the doughnuts!
author: Crystal L.

description: So I came here twice and unfortunately couldn't get those famous cruffins. I got something else instead (donut like thing and cream cheese pie or something). The both pastries were ok, but not worth staying in line!
author: Aya J.

description:
Great treats. We arrived about an hour and a half after opening and the cromuffins were already gone. But they quickly replaced them with other options. 

Most of the baked goods are croissant-like, so if you don't enjoy light and flaky pastries your options are limited here. However, everything we tried was delicious even on the second day. 

The space is a little tight especially if there is a line but they don't rush you out of the place so not complaints there. Would definitely come back again.
author: Marcia S.

description:
Cruffins are available each day at 9am, only 1 flavour per day (changes each time), limited to 2 per person. Having had them thrice, going at 9am in the middle of the week each time and waiting 10min max, I'd say they are a tad overrated. I often find the filling to be too sweet, and the eating of the cruffin extremely awkward due to its shape. Not recommended to eat with one hand, and type with the other at work.

Donuts - on the other hand - are DELICIOUS. All the yes. All the donuts please.
author: Vivien O.

description: My friend and I had dinner around the corner and stopped by to look in the window. Although they just opened today, we were invited in for a free sample. We both had a custard filled chocolate croissant. If you decide to get one of these make sure you have plenty of napkins on hand. One of the best croissants I've ever had.
author: Timothy G. F.

description:
Cruffins were great but hard to eat

We both enjoyed the creme filled donuts the most. you could consume them as fast you mouth wanted to. #nomnomnom
author: R M.

description:
I very much expect this review will be edited once I eat the pastries I bought but I wanted to make sure I added this note before I forgot. While everyone there was perfectly friendly and nice, the decor was good, pastries looked delicious, and we had an ironically amusing time standing in the rain for 30 minutes at 8 am when we got to the front, cruffins (the reason there was a line of people at 8 am) aren't available till 9 am. 

So, if you want cruffins don't go until 9. Don't try to get there early. My opinion is that a bakery should put out its most popular options when it opens! Especially since the croissants were already out which means the staff had had time to make the croissant dough. It is just annoying since that means its clearly a business strategy to sell extras of the other pastries and make the cruffins available for longer.

Edit - OK, you win this round Mr Holmes. Your Choux Bomb is a 5 star pastry. But I'm still docking you a star for the silly cruffins policy!
author: Thom B.

description: Hole in the wall place. Line waiting at door before opening. We were there too early for the cruffins   Pastries were good. Good place to stop and get to go since no place to sit
author: Janice B.

description: We came late in the day (make sure you call first and make sure that thy haven't sold out, which they do regularly), and didn't have to wait at all. Super yummy, light, and flavorful! Definitely worth the wait if you have to wait in line!
author: Emmaza216 ..

description: Stood in line for Cruffins but the California croissant was surprisingly my favorite. Did not expect to like it as wasabi and smoked salmon sounded weird inside a croissant but I was very wrong.
author: Andrew H.

description: The cruffins are worth the wait!!! Been here in March for my bachelorette and my sweet friends lined up to get some cruffins! Well it was their 3rd attempt while we were on the trip lol first day they were sold out. Second day the line was too long and we finally got them on our third trial.  The cruffins have the butter crusty texture of croissant and inside is their delicious filling.  Definitely one of our favorite places while were on the trip, even brought some back on the plane!
author: Alex P.

description: When I arrived at 8:40 there was already a line of 20 people waiting for cronuts.  The chocolate chip cookie and smores cronut were both awesome and 5 stars, however the ube pastry and the bread pudding were both average. Maybe if I didn't come in with such high expectations the last two pastries would not seem so mediocre. I have yet to try the amann - but that looks delicious!
author: Lauren H.

description: Supremely delicious and uniquely interesting take on baked good. Somewhat challenging ordering process. Spirited employees delight.
author: Alexander T.

description: LoVe LoVe LOVE this spot. The cruffins are Devine & its not too sweet, that's the best thing about their pastries. It's a croissant in the shape of a muffin with a filling in the center. And they have unique flavors that weirdly go together & taste delicious. Their filled donuts are also very good with not too sweet fillings. If you order $30 or more you get your pastries in a MR. bake house box. It's kinda like a shoe box. They don't sell the cruffins till 9am. So the line usually starts outside around 8:30. So be prepared to wait in line! All their Pastries are soo good so don't be sad if there are no more cruffins. Try something else you won't be disappointed.
author: Royal H.

description: Waited in a long ass line on a Sunday morning only to come to find out when we got to counter that they don't sell cruffins on weekends....boooooh. what a bummer. We ordered a regular crossiant...jelly donut...strawberry jalapeño muffin...artichoke streudel. Was good but disappointed we didn't get a cruffin. My belly was all set for it
author: Paula G.

description: I first heard of Mr. Holmes Bake house  via ig and wanted to try their famous cruffins on our SF trip. Fresh off the plane we headed straight over there around 10am. To our surprise they sold out of almost everything in their bake house. We we're so bummed. Needless to say we actually walked way with 2 pcs of chocolate crossiants that were still delicious.  The cashier told us that we would have to come around 8am if we wanted to try the rest of their pastries.
author: D C.

description:
This place is so popular and there is a reason.  The cruffins, the croissants and the donuts are
melt in your mouth are wonderful.  Food that makes San Francisco just past of the reason for visiting or living there if you are lucky.
author: Barbara L.

description: Everything about this place is fabulous...from the pink neon, the graphic on the front doors, the music, even the boxes.  The pastries and coffee really are delicious...love it so much.
author: Tippi M.

description: I thought my son was crazy when he said that we needed to be in the Mr. HOLMES line by 830am on a Saturday morning. Much to my shagrin I mustard the energy and stood in the rain. Well Thank God I did!!! The cruffin (crossaint/muffin) was a wonderful custardy cream filled pastry treat that was to die for! I savored every bite. A small warning...they can be addicting!! Mr. HOLMES serves a wide varity of breads, cakes, pastries, quiche and their specialty "Cruffins". A definite find here in SF.
author: Roxanne S.

description: Just got there thinking was open, we open the door and  a girl scream us WE ARE CLOSE And smash the door. And at the question what time do you open she never answer. Rude, will never go there again no matter what.
author: Cristina C.

description: The quintessential San Francisco hot spot. Lucky me lives a few blocks away so I often get to stop in without a line and grab a few goodies. Pretty pricey, but definitely awesome.
author: Madie H.

description:
The pastries were all are scrumptious.  We had the banana doughnut, passion fruit doughnut, ham and cheese danish and the mushroom danish.  The ham and cheese danish was the best savory item--buttery, flaky with a kick of dijon mustard seeds.  

Unfortunately, we didn't get try a cruffin.  We didn't know that only a limited supply of cruffins are made available at 9am, and that, despite waiting in line, the store sells out of cruffins by 10am or earlier.

Otherwise, everything about this place is done well--delicious, super Instagrammable, clean and fun.
author: Catherine T.

description: I did it. I woke up early, got out of bed and showed up an hour early to wait in line for a cruffin.  Got there a couple minutes after 8 and there were already two people in line. The place is already open so you gotta wait outside and answer questions from people walking by about why your standing there, and what's the big deal about a "cruffin".  Well finally after waiting an hour in the cold we were allowed in to get our cruffins. They make an entrance for the food, they have music playing. They make a big deal if it, and plenty of reason why. That day's flavor was rocky road. Rocky road for a breakfast pastry? It worked.  The inside was filled with a chocolate pudding almost, and the exterior was covered in sugar. It was a bit of a mess to eat, but it was a delicious mess. My only fault was I waited about an hour or so to eat it so I feel it wasn't as soft as it would be super fresh.  Never the less, this was awesome! Also while there I picked up a blackberry bostock and raspberry filled fried donut. Those were the under dogs right there. I feel those were better than the cruffin itself and not as much hype. I would for sure come back here in a heart beat, but would only wait in line for a cruffin if someone else really wanted to. Other than that, their other parties i feel were sweeter and a great unexpected surprise.
author: Mike S.

description: The food here is very good I would give it 4/5 stars. Unfortunately my overall rating is a 3/5 because the staff was very unfriendly. I walked into the bakery really excited and I was not greeted, instead I had to say hi first. When I needed to ask questions about the pastries and food the staff seemed less than willing to answer them. Such a shame a great bakery has unfriendly workers.
author: Kristen B.

description: What an amazing treat and experience. Now I know why people wait in line for the cruffins. We had the hummingbird cruffin (pretty sure I got the name wrong) and it melted in my mouth. Incredible blend of flavors. The staff is very friendly and doesn't seem put off by the many questions. Jeremy hooked us up and seemed genuinely interested in what we were going to do the rest of the day.
author: Eddie P.

description:
My oh my, I've put myself at a disadvantage for not trying this bakery sooner.

I came here on a Sunday morning around 10AM and, thankfully, they still had delicious Cruffins left. The flavor was Mint Chocolate for that day, and it was delectable. It didn't taste like artificial mint chocolate chip ice cream, it was much fresher and tasted more like actual mint plant. My only issue with the flavor was that there was a lack of the chocolate flavor, but the tiny chocolate balls at the top of the cruffin offered some chocolatey-ness to it. The orange creme cronut was not good at all, it tasted like the rind of an orange. The other pastries they sold were delicious, and I definitely will come back to try more and more of what they have. The employees were super friendly and helpful, and will explain any pastry out of the selection they have available. Just remember to not be rude and hold up the line -- tons of other people want to try the deliciousness too.

Tips:
- Follow them on Instagram. They post flavor updates every week, so that way you can be aware of what you can potentially get in terms of the flavors for the cruffins and cronuts.
- The flavor normally determines how fast the cronut or cruffin (mainly cruffin) will sell. If it's something deemable as normal, like Mint Chocolate, then there's no need to come too early to wait in a line in the early AM to try it out. If it's something seemingly unique, like Pink Rose Champagne, then come and line up early. We foodies have the same mindset about flavors.
- Get someone to wait in the car for you. It's much easier to have a system of one person waiting in line while another person stays in the car/looks for parking.
- Order 6 pastries to get a box for free. If you get less than 6 pastries and still want a box, you'll have to pay $1.50 for the box itself.
- Take a picture with the "I got baked in San Francisco" sign for foodie proof :)

Definitely give this place a try, it's delicious, but be aware of the flavors so you won't be disappointed. Not everyone will like all flavors crafted up by the Mr. Holmes team.
author: Rayna U.

description: The first time I went to Mr. Holmes, I was a bit too late to get a cruffin so I decided to try the pain au chocolat and california croissant. Both of them had ok croissant texture (not as buttery and flaky as some of the best croissants I've had - the Tartine pain au chocolat is better). However, the originality of the california croissant made it worth the try. The next time I got there earlier enough to try their pink rose champagne cruffin. The cruffin looked awesome, and tasted pretty decent. There was a bit too much filling and the pastry texture was the same as their other croissants. I'd go back to try a different cruffin filling and to get another california croissant but not something i'd line up more than 30 mins for.
author: Karen D.

description: The pastries are good but not worth the line. Jane across the street has just as good of pastries, slightly cheaper, no line, and customer service. The people serving the treats here aren't very friendly and they aren't very good at getting things moving. They also close whenever they want. They'll work a few hours in the morning and when the line stops they shut their doors. If you're a new age San Franciscan that enjoys standing in line just because everyone else is, have at it, I have better places to spend my time, like actually eating pastries.
author: Sophia P.

description: Amazing! Waiting in line for 30mins and was totally worth it! We did a box and my fav was the salmon! Will be back!
author: Cassie C.

description: wow... my wonderful coworker got me their green tea strawberry curtains and I thought I had died and gone to heaven! They were soo delicious - I can't believe I have never tried them before!!! I am definitely going back to try out different flavors and specials :) I think I found one of my FAVORITE sweets places in SF!!!
author: Katelyn M.

description: Great pastries,  but way over-priced.  Always a line of twenty-somethings snaking down the street. Coffee is good and staff is friendly.
author: Mark E.

description: The wonderful donut filled with something delightful is heavenly and I used to wait in line! Now the lines are too long but I think between Tartine and Mr. Holmes, when I have time to burn, I'll hit either depending on what part of town I'm heading.
author: Ros M.

description:
This place definitely lived up to it's Instagram fame.

I ordered a few items from this place for my coworkers and myself.  Below are the things I remembered although I think I got others.  I guess I just remembered the important ones?..

Four Barrel Coffee Flavored Cruffin-
The texture of a true croissant (flaky and crispy) enveloping a nice chilled filling of Four Barrel coffee flavored cream.  This was a great combination because Four Barrel coffee has amazing strong flavors.  There was nothing muffin about this pastry but the size and shape, which was a little taller than the usual muffin.  

The California Croissant-
Amazing.  Imagine a California roll but instead of rice you wrap the meat of the roll into a croissant.  This too was very flaky and crispy, but the inside was a nice meaty (but not meat) surprise.  If you're on the savory side of food, this a great pastry to get instead of the sweets that you usually get from bakeries. 

Custard Filled Donut-
Imagine a jelly donut except the inside is custard.  This was okay and felt like a typical item to have at a bakery.  They do have many different flavors and the custard filling is chilled like in the cruffin.

Overall thoughts, this is a great trendy place that lives up to it's hype.  Would I come here everyday, probably not.  It's pricier than other traditional bakeries, but it's a hipster spot, it's supposed to be.  I came here to try it, and I would go back if I wanted to surprise a friend with a treat or something for their birthday.  Lines can get long, and they only serve certain cruffin flavors on certain days.  Cruffins are only available at 9am and they sell out quick.
author: AJ T.

description: Delicious!! I got to the line like at 8:30 on Sunday morning. While waiting in line I ask the person behind me to hold my spot while I bought a chocolate croissant inside. Once they started selling the cruffins at 9 line went by pretty fast, they're ready for lots of people. I love desserts and these are amazing! One definitely must try them. The look inside of the little shop is very neat too, staff is friendly and I can't wait to go back.
author: Daniela B.

description: Extremely yummy pastries. You probably know this. I did not wait in line for cromagnons or whatever but walked right in at 9 for everything else. Maybe the cromanganese are worth it but those people waited an hour, I waited zero seconds.  Great pastries, great people, go there
author: David S.

description: Sadly, after today of how I was treated I will not ever step into this shop again. I walked in as I waited for the two girls at the front end to finish their conversation. One was snacking on pastries and the other standing. Then I was asked, "What are you doing here".... I do deliveries and so I embarked upon hidden gems in the city. Despite the reason of why I was there in the first place. I was treated like some one who lives on the street, or maybe couldn't afford their bakery, and as I recall... Treating everyone that walks into the shop the same.
author: MsTeenaChick ..

description:
The staff is really sweet and helpful! Also...CRUFFIN! They were on point. The pastry cream inside was so creamy and delicious. The croissant part was flaky. It's slightly overpriced, but that's to be expected in San Francisco.

Go early is my best advice- the line will be LONG!
author: Ariana S.

description: Not worth going past 10 am. There was almost nothimg left and the girls working seemed to be in a rush to close the store.
author: Aïcha S.

description: Minus star because by the time I arrive all the cruffins are sold out.  However, if I get there on time there's at least one cruffin left.  P&B cruffin was good!
author: Angelique B.

description:
Stopped by Mr Holmes Bakehouse on my trip to San Franscisco because A) I have seen plenty of Instagram photos of this place and was dying to try it out B) Because I make it my mission to try all amazing dessert/bakeries C) How can you not try something with 700+ reviews and 4 stars on Yelp?

We ended up getting there at 8:45 a.m. and there was probably a line of about 20 people (after reading reviews on Yelp it definitely wasn't as long as it could be). If you get there before 9 a.m. there are 2 lines, one waiting for the cruffins to come out at 9.a.m. and the other to get regular baked good. For that one you can just walk into the store and they will help you. 

The day I went our flavor was the Lemon Ginger Raspberry cruffin. It was delicious. It was the mix of a sugar coated muffin, a croissant and a donut with frosting inside. I can't do justice to it, but it tasted amazing! If the trip back didn't involve a cross country plane ride for me, I would be back there in a heartbeat.

Pro Tips:
-They only allow 2 cruffins per person, so if you want more than 2 you better have a friend or four waiting in line with you.
-They don't start serving the cruffins till 9 a.m., so don't go there at 7:30 expecting to get your hands on a cruffin
-I ended up saving a cruffin that had sat in a moderately warm car all day Thursday and ate it on Saturday morning. (Not that many would be able to resist saving it that many days, but if you do it still tasted good and okay to eat!)
author: R C.

description:
Their slogan "I Got Baked in San Francisco," should be plastered across the Mission more-so than the Tenderloin.

I got baked alright... so baked my stomach filled up like a donut hole after all was said and done.

Here are some of the items I got:

(http://instagram.com/p/w6x6Nbnh6o/?modal=true)

The Ferrerro Rocher Choux was deceitful... and I like it. Although it lacked the nuttiness and essence the original candy had. This was a creamy and well balanced hazelnut-chocolate duo of flavors. It was like Brian McKnight and Mariah Carey had a reunion concert in Las Vegas... and 10 years later.. still killed it.

Their Signature Cruffin, reminded me so much of an old fan favorite of mine (Cream Pan's Strawberry-Banana Custard Croissants). Substitute the muffin for the croissant, add a killer custard and some slices of strawberries (jesus, I need to stop). Anyway this one was just as good, lots of flakiness but not was moist in the center a little dry and a bit more heavy with the sugar. I was hoping for it to be a bit lighter on the sugar coating so I could avoid cavities but sometimes you gotta live it up.

I also tried a ham and cheese bread and their amelia amann. The Ham and Cheese, cannot be commented on simply because I forgot the balance in components (my apologies). However their amann, had nothing on B Patisserie's. It was glossy and sweet but didn't held up with the perfect balance of crispy and flakiness I am accustomed to.

The Customer Service was excellent, I hope I remembered the right person correctly (I believe it was Bridget). She answered all of my questions and helped me cleared an accidental spill I caused (sorry about that) without leering at me. 

Overall, I enjoyed my first tasting so far the only cons are the slightly bit excessive sugar on the Strawberry (the Coffee cream Cruffins, which were tasty in their own right). Despite the location being a bit cramped, perhaps a few more stools or small tabletops would help in seating for guests? Especially if they want a quick (and un-interrupted) bite before venturing back out into the begging vultures of the Tenderloin.

3.5, but bumped up to four due to excellent customer service and another bakeshop to possibly rival Tout Sweet Patisserie and Craftsman and Wolves.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I wanted to like Mr. Holmes...I mean, you don't wait in a 30 minute line thinking it's not going to be good.  But it just didn't live up to the hype.  In fairness, they sold out of their famous cruffins (around 9:45AM) but given how I felt about all of the other pastries I tasted (we tried 6 in total), I doubt I would have liked the cruffin much (the cashier said the cruffin was similar in flavor to the donuts but with the texture of a croissant...and unfortunately I didn't like the flavor of the donut).  Basically, I felt like it was all heavy handed and not as refined as some of the other bakeries I love.  And I do have a big sweet tooth and am generally happy with any sweet eats. So really bummed I was disappointed.  Here's what we tried and a little review of each:

1.  Chocolate Chip Cookie with Salt on top:  A decent chocolate chip cookie but a little on the sweet side...does not live up to the B. Patisserie chocolate chip cookie (also with salt).  Or he chocolate chip cookie they sell at Fraiche on Fillmore.  (3/5)

2.  Blackberry Bostock:  I enjoyed this but I didn't think it was worth standing in line for.  The tart blackberries were a nice balance with the crusty, buttery french toast like bread.  (4/5)

3.  Chocolate Donut:  Too sweet, just not very good.  Felt heavy, wasn't a light donut which I prefer.  (3/5)

4.  Regular Croissant:  Fine...but not better than Rustic Bakery  (3/5)

5.  California Croissant with smoked salmon inside:  Enjoyed this b/c it is unique.  I thought it was odd that they give you a soy sauce packet to go with it.  It's smoked salmon so it is definitely salty enough and doesn't need the soy sauce (another reason I kind of think the flavors are heavy handed).  (5/5 - didn't use soy sauce).

6.  Ube Pastry:  We asked the lady helping us if it was very sweet and she said no.  I should have trusted my instinct when I saw the thick layer of bright pink frosting on top.  The frosting is too sweet and overpowering.  The ube inside is more subtle.  But the pastry was thick and not as flaky/light as I would have liked.  After first few bites with frosting, we removed all the frosting (and some pastry shell) to make it more edible.  Meh. Least favorite. It's a shame b/c I think it could have been good if it was a lighter pastry shell and just the ube filling.  (1/5)

All in all, I would never recommend this place to friends...maybe if there weren't a wait it would be OK...but I personally won't go back with or without a wait.  Go to B. Patisserie instead.
author: J O.

description: Can you say hype? Cuz Mr. Holmes sure can. We found this place to be almost nauseatingly sugary, despite all the buzz about the studied pastry techniques going on behind the scenes. All of the filled pastries we had (a cruffin and a donut) were ridiculously full of custard, to the point that it was difficult to even get a sense of the pastry as more than just a custard conveying unit. The chocolate in the chocolate croissant was also weirdly sour, and the croissant itself was somewhat gummy and over baked. The people working there were great, but all in all, its not worth the hyped up price tag. If you want to feel this hip, just move to Brooklyn.
author: Henry C.

description:
Cruffins are overhypeddddddddddddd. They're too greasy and sweet for my liking. 

Get the chocolate chip cookie and donuts instead!
author: Chelsea L.

description: This is for the cruffin! My hubby was in the area around 8:30am and saw that the line wasn't that long yet. You can't get the cruffins till 9am. They give you a sticker to make sure you are guaranteed one. The flavor was mexican chocolate. It was very yummy. Nice and flaky and it was good the next day still. Only worth it if you don't have to wait that long.
author: Karen H.

description: This bakery has the best pastries ever. I can't tell you how good they are unless you try them there is no comparison.
author: Judy A.

description: Small little spot for grabbing intelligencia coffee and a pastry on the go. I didn't get the cruffin when I went because I didn't know it was something this place was known for but the place itself is cool and definitely worth a try.
author: Alex D.

description: It's not just the Cruffins, but every single pastry is amazing here. Tiny little shop on a street that is hard to park on, but WELL worth it!
author: Michelle F.

description: Man...eating a cruffin with a mustache is a challenge haha, the mess is totally worth it though. When I saw the pictures I thought It was too much, but once I ate it I enjoyed it to the last bite. It is so flaky and it has a lot of filling that it is creamy, tasty and light at the same time. There was a long line for cruffins (NOTE: there is a separate line for all the other pastries, so be sure to know where you are standing) but it went somewhat fast. The staff is super friendly and they will let you know if you will be able to get a cruffin. I will be there again for sure.
author: Santiago D.

description:
after being one of the most instagrammed places, i knew i had to check this place out for the cruffins and the "i got baked in sf" sign. the bakery opens at 7am (8am on weekends) but cruffins only come out at 9am and limited to only 2 per person!! i went on a thursday morning a little after 9 and that was a 40min wait. they sell out so i suggest you make it there if you want that. some will disagree but i think the cruffin was the best thing i tried there. way better than the cronut for sure. the filling and the flakiness is just to die for

the donut flavors changes everyday too. they have a variety and they are quite delicious but very sweet. i got a thai curry bun or something and that was my second favorite. the flavors were amazing. and got a new item that i already forgot the name of.. resembled a coffee cake that the worker recommended but it was just ok.
author: Jen S.

description: I think my hopes for this place were too high- I hate to write a bad review but I was honestly underwhelmed! The pastries just aren't that great. The cruffins are a little oily, the pear Danish was really unspectacular. Nothing that we ordered (2 cruffins, 3 donuts, a Danish) was that great, it all tasted pretty mediocre and like it was made with mediocre ingredients (read: you feel gross and unhealthy after eating these). The best thing was probably the vanilla donut. Both the cruffins and donuts were filled with a custard that was kinda gross and also felt unhealthy and overwhelming. Plus side- pretty shop, pretty pastries, pretty boxes.
author: Ava S.

description: This Cruffin thing will make you lose your mind and put up with long lines, hipster tude, and pricey, designer pastries.  I could probably eat an entire schmancy box of them!
author: Jhonna R.

description: Delicious! There is always a reason for the line. Sticky buns were really good. Flavors were on point. Variety is not that big but its even better with decision making. The indoor sign os really cool.
author: Gabrirlla P.

description: All im going to say here, is i wake up early once a week, and its to get myself 2 cruffins and a box of other goodies. Some of the best pastries ive ever had. Highly recommend! Make sure to get there around 8-830 to get a cruffin, but dont be discouraged if you dont since everything else is amazing too.
author: Kirill P.

description: I stop in here mid day sometimes when there's no line and the treats are excellent and so is the coffee. I particularly like the French toast with fruit on top. check it out if you haven't already!
author: Matt M.

description: So worth the wait! Literally everything is delicious. I especially love the cookies with sea salt. Get baked!
author: Beau D.

description: Novel and somewhat gimmicky baked goods, but it's fun.   I got there when there wasn't a line, but not sure I would stand for a long time. Given then do unusual items, it's worth trying different things and you may like them.  So I suspect you either will like something or come away disappointed.  If you go for something that's "normal", then it's not going to please you much.   But if you find something you won't find anywhere else (like puppy chow on a pastry), you'll be a fan.
author: Dan C.

description: This review is only for the chocolate chip cookies from uberEATS. They give you two large cookies so you can satisfy your mid day sweet tooth craving. I definitely can't finish 2 of the cookies by myself in one sitting. They're soft and yummy, 2 very important things you need in your cookie.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Our hotel just happen to be near this place so the wife and I checked out what all the fuss was about for these cruffins that everyone keeps raving about.  After showing up on a weekday at 7:30 AM and finally able to buy four (limit 2 per person) after 9:00 AM we tried one.  I have to admit it was really good.  Light and airy and filled with a raspberry vanilla creme filling (flavor of the day), it was delicious.  That said I'm not sure its worth waiting in line for two hours but I'm glad I tried it. I feel sorry for the people waiting at the end of the line because they sell out within an hour. The rest of there bake goods are also very good and you don't have to wait hours like you do for the cruffins. I like their California croissant with smoked salmon, seaweed and wasabi inside. It even comes with a packet of soy sauce.
author: Riverside G.

description: I had the ube puff pastry and chocolate croissant. The chocolate croissant was delicious. The ube puff pastry was a little too sweet for me. I think I would've liked it more without the icing on top.
author: Connie N.

description: Pretty good, I have to admit. Not the best, but pretty good. I don't know. If you wan't something quick and easy, then this is the place to go. Sorry for the short review.
author: Jj T.

description: Awesome bake goods! The croissants are what you want from a croissant. The dough was made very well. Soft inside to die for!
author: Zachary A.

description: Yes, everything here is delicious. The line for cruffins is pretty crazy though, even on a rainy Saturday morning at 9am. Bring a friend and good humor (also an umbrella if it's raining. You don't want to stand in the rain for 45 minutes.)
author: Rubina C.

description: Mr. Holmes Bakery has an uphill battle. You go just before 9 (because heaven forbid they bake the thing everybody wants to be available when they open), the line already goes down the block, the fanboy behind you panics every 30 seconds that they'll be sold out by the time you get up there, and then after you've done your diligence and the waited it out you buy some cruffins (and something else because why not?) and dig it. Now I've had duffins, cronuts, croissants, muffins, etc., etc. I'm aware of the component parts here and have seen some of the hybrids. Was the cruffin good? Sure. Was it worth it? When you realize the absurdity of what you're doing when tons of places across SF have pastries that are as good (if not better) that you can go buy anytime of the day, then no. But if you're the kind of person who loves it when people stare jealously at that white and pink bag and those golden fingers exclaiming "peace" then this place is for you homies.
author: Stephen S.

description: I was expecting more. The stuff I tried was good, but based on the raving reviews I was hoping for something more.
author: Stephanie D.

description: All I can say is I saw this place on Yelp and the pictures of cruffins. I told my husband I wasn't leaving San Francisco without getting one! We walked forever from our hotel to get there. By 9:30 there were 5 cruffins left! We bought 2 along with some doughnuts. Let me tell you, they are outstanding! One of the best treats I have ever had!!! Craving one now lol You haven't lived until you have had a CRUFFIN
author: Karen A.

description: We thought pastries from Jane (a block away) was way better.
author: Paiyu G.

description: The Cruffin is amazing! Also, the donuts can't be missed. There was a line when we got there Saturday morning around 10am. However, it only took 12 minutes from the time we got in line to the time we checked out.
author: Michelle Z.

description: What is a pleasure of mine is when I have a variety to choose from. It's like when  Sherlock Holmes chooses from the multitude of his skills to solve the case. By the way, there is a Mr Holmes Bakehouse with many sweeties to choose from, ... and I want to eat, ... so let's go there!
author: Aaron R.

description: Fine French pastries meets delicious donuts, excellent gourmet donuts. SF prides itself on its authentic local establishments and the more flashy high end gourmet, this is the high end gourmet donut experience I was looking for in SF (and bobs donuts as a contrast is a great mom and pop donut store with excellent execution). Everything at Mr Holmes was incredible. The donuts, croissant, Danishes, ube puff and more were all grand champion. A great quick breakfast option
author: Oink A.

description: Everyone knows about, has waited for, and has raved about the famous Cruffin. They are incredible. But what gets glossed over is how well they do everything else. In fact, I had one of the top 3 chocolate chip cookies here. So if you miss the Cruffin rush, don't worry, just enjoy the best of the other stuff they have to offer.
author: Michael M.

description: Yikes Bikes. Get the passion fruit filled donut. You're life will forever be changed. The flavor was honestly unreal. I also got the Cardamom filled donut. This was very very very good- but the Passion fruit donut WINS!!
author: Karen A.

description: Cruffins? More like a cup of custard with a croissant shell. Sure, the croissant part was great, but the custard was very meh and it was at least two thirds of the cruffin. Was not worth a 45 minute line. Cookie was decent, would definitely recommend the California croissant though. Pretty overrated overall.
author: Dan H.

description: Get there early so you can get the cruffins!!! so so good always a line but totally worth it
author: Lili T.

description: Delicious doughnuts. Honestly the cruffin isn't all it's cracked up to be. I got there just after 9am, when they start selling them, and mine wasn't all that flakey--it tasted old.
author: A. B.

description: Rude staff, especially the heavy set lady. The pastries are good though but a little pricey for what they are.
author: Ana V.

description: Everything is just WOW! Be prepared to wait in line, worth it though! Also, they occasionally participate in UberEats!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Over due & much needed review. 
So the cruffin is great, nothing wrong with the cruffin. It's their other pastries that are not up to a $4.50 standard. So there is never cruffins available, and if and when there is the line is the most ridiculous thing you have ever seen. There are two lines, one only for cruffins and one for all the other stuff, So if you are not in the cruffin line you are screwed. 
So after living near Mr Holmes since they opened my bf decided to grab us some breakfast. He comes back with three items, one was the passion fruit thing, a scone, and a bagel looking blueberry thing. Don't ever get the passion fruit cream thing, seriously tasted like sour throw up, I am not being a hater, like I said I love the cruffin. The scone was a shame, I have had better. The bagel looking blueberry thing was the only one that was okay, not worth the $4.50, kinda made me want a real bagel haha. 

To sum it all up, this trendy hipster overrated bakery is only good for the "cruffin" and who knows if the cruffin is still living up to its standards (I had it once before the place blew up with the crazy following). The main baker quit a while ago, so waiting in line for over an hour for a cruffin might not be worth it guys.
author: Pita Q.

description: If you are looking for some real and fresh baked pastries, this is the place to go. Plus, there's a neon sign inside that is a great picture opportunity. Kids would love it.
author: Quintin W.

description: The filled donuts are my favorite but the cruffins are incredible too. I've had flavors I've loved and flavors I didn't care for- they're different every time. It's a fun atmosphere and their packaging is to die for.
author: Dani T.

description: CRUFFIN & CHOUX BOMB! Grab it the next time your in! 5 star for a very awesome place and very accommodating staff!
author: Hanna L.

description: Made the mistake of not checking social media before coming. Luckily I didn't have to trudge through any excruciating long lines but I did come here for the cruffins only to eventually find out their oven stopped working. (RIP) ): Left with a donut instead....still good nonetheless. The chocolate banana filling was really good, and I typically don't like banana flavored pastries.
author: Amanda L.

description: i waited about 1 hour for the cruffins, today was peppermint bark. I liked it but there was too much creme and was too sweet.
author: Kat N.

description:
I read all about Mr. Holmes Bakehouse and maybe it was overhyped but I came in with high expectations.  I went a total of three times and purchased cruffins twice to ensure I had the full experience.  Some items were hit or miss for me and while everyone talks about the cruffins, they weren't my favorite. My favorite was actually the vanilla custard doughnut.

Some items were definitely hit or miss for me such as their cookies and croissants.  This was definitely one of the better bakeries I've been to but I wouldn't stand in line for 1+ hour to get a cruffin or 30 minutes for other bakeries.  I'd rather go somewhere else. 

Go early and get your cruffin to try...then move on to other bakeries.
author: Remus L.

description: People start lining up at 6:30 am like it's a methadone clinic. Yes, it's good, but c'mon people.
author: El B.

description: We stopped by Mr Holmes Bakehouse after seeing rave Pinterest reviews. Unfortunately, the cruffin of the day flavor was raspberry and rosewater, and I am just not a fan of rose flavoring, so I couldn't rate the cruffin very highly. My mom had a savory pastry that she really enjoyed though. I probably wouldn't go back having experienced it once. I wish they had more chocolate offerings, like a chocolate stuffed donut!
author: Allie G.

description: The pasties are light, flakey and crispy... Just what you'd expect and then crave from a bakery like this.
author: Alisa G.

description: Went to Jane on Larkins and then over to Mr Holmes. Not a big pastry guy but there stuff was really good! I really liked the pear and blue cheese pastry
author: Mike B.

description: Worth the wait. I approve! We were fortunate enough to come early enough for the infamous Cruffin! I wouldn't come here every day...it's pricey....but well worth it
author: Ashley A.

description: Absolutely delicious! The infamous cruffins were sold out by the time we got there. So get there early! We arrived by 11am and all of them were gone. We opted for the whiskey cream donut instead which did not disappoint. Incredibly moist and fluffy dough, with the whiskey cream being the perfect compliment to the cinnamon sugar dusting. Yum!
author: Stephanie H.

description: We went in the early afternoon and the lineup was out the door but moved very quickly. I was shocked to find out there isn't seating room, just standing room. Not a place to sit down and enjoy your pastry and latte. We also missed the cruffins. :( I didn't see what they had to drink so I ended up just getting a few pastries. They were tasty. The "I got baked" sign was lovely and it was fun to take touristy photos with it.
author: Kelsey V.

description:
Awesome place. Love their Cruffins & Doughnuts. It was worth the wait.
Make sure you get there early enough for the Cruffins before they sell out.
author: Naomi S.

description: My friends and I made it just in time to grab the last few cruffins before they were sold out.... REALLY GOOD (can get messy, though)! That day, we tried the mint chocolate chip cruffin and it was delicious. When you go, there are 2 lines: left side is for cruffins, right side is for other pastries. Their other pastries looked just as delectable, so I definitely will return and try their other goodies.
author: Faye F.

description: I'm so sad I was not able to get a cruffin this morning. That's really what I came here for but since they don't start selling their cruffins until 9am, that was a no can do. Work waits for no one :(. In its place I got a chocolate croissant and the Mr. got a peanut butter filled donut. I can only speak for the chocolate croissant but it was perfectly butter and flaky with just the right amount of chocolate. I am not one of those chicks who lives and dies by chocolate. A good size for the $4 price and very filling. I'll be back for the cruffins on a random day I am in the city at 9am.
author: Ramla J.

description: A great place to have muffin and a cup of coffee, all bakes are just great quality. I come here once in a while, but planning to visit it more often. My bidy recommended this place.
author: James R.

description: The pastries are good.  You just don't get to buy what you would like after the long wait.
author: D N.

description: Waited in huge, God-forsaken line at 8am for quite some time before being told that they unless you had a sticker (passed out even earlier) that you could not have a cruffin. I wasn't too disappointed but moved to the other line to try their other pastries. Sadly, every other pastry I got was nothing to write home about. The apple-filled pastry tasted like it was filled with applesauce which was not my style. This place is typical of some spots in SF where they purposely create scarcity to drive the masses wild. Hence, everyone takes pictures with the signs and posts about how they got one of the oh-so-coveted cruffins. If you are a bakery that runs out of what you are famous for at 8am then I would say you have a failing business. In SF tho, it makes you famous. I will not be back on principle.
author: Melissa D.

description: They ran out of cruffins so I got a sugar puff donut with hazelnut-chocolate filling. The donut was soft, and fluffy, but the hazelnut cream was bland. There were moments I could taste some deep chocolate flavored, but they were fleeting and the hazelnut was nearly imperceptible. Honestly, they would be better served with Nutella then what they are using.
author: Alex D.

description: Good Quality stuff. Cruffin didn't win me over - it was good - but not sure if it was worth the wait. Chocolate - Cardamom donut and Blackberry toast was awesome though. I'd definitely come back next time I'm in town.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Ferraro Rocher Choux Bomb is DELICIOUS!! very light and tasty. I wish I bought 2! Has a little caramel piece on top but it was honestly good without it. I really wanted to try a cruffin. But of course they were out :(
author: Tam V.

description: If only pastries were good for you, I'd eat Mr Holmes every day. From a French girl to you, their croissants and other pastries are out of this world. I have rarely found good pastries in the US and I am so thankful for my friend to show me this place.
author: Lea O.

description: 1 star for not being able to supply the demand. Came here at 11 on a sunday and they were "Sold out" Sorry people. they dont respect y our time or they are not organize enough to bake enough for everyone. I'm sure they could make more to supply the demand and satisfy people who come from afar. They choose not to. 1 star for them.
author: d n.

description: Interesting treats, but a little pricey. Perhaps that's just assumed nowadays. The chocolate cream filmed donut with a hint of mint was unique.
author: IP B.

description: Super overrated to get in line for a croissant mashup with a muffin. Never waiting in this line ever again.
author: Betty C.

description: Good pastries in the area. If you come in the afternoon there's no lines but then again there's no cruffins either
author: Josie M.

description: CRUFFINS. I'm always super excited to get a cruffin at 8am on Sunday mornings. Everyone hates me in line but IDFWU! It's the perfect wake up call. Definitely worth the hype my San Franciscans!
author: Mimi N.

description: Meh.  I bought a plethora of goodies and was unimpressed.  If you want a quick donut fix, don't be intimidated off the line of tourists waiting for the cruffins, just go right inside.
author: Mark M.

description:
omgagaga i don't even know where to begin and already drooling with imaging the first bite i took of my strawberry milk shake cruffin! 

once a upon a time, on a thursday morning around 9 30 am, is when i got there. when i arrived i was like holy molly there are 15 to 20 people in line for their cruffin! i was like it must be really good or it can really hyped up good. i went ahead and wait in line and it was about 20 min wait, since i had time to write a review for sight glass. 

Apparently they didn't have a menu since they always change the menu of the pastry daily I'm thinking. so they have a nice glass display and theres a sign says what it is and how much it is. then you point out which one you want and if you order 6 items they then give a nice box to wrap it up otherwise its a white paper bag. 

so the cruffin flavor is unknown according to other yelpers, it changes daily but i ran into the flavor i wanted to try which was strawberry milk shake flavor. i then order that of course and nothing else since i just came here for this. so then it was like a cute muffin or cupcake type of shape, with strawberry jam and marshmellow on top. 

i then went ahead and pay for it and took the cruffin outside and devoured it. i first took a picture of it since my camera always eat first than i do. next i bit into the flaky crisp light sugar coated on the outside which was amazing! and then as i got into the middle i feel the oozing strawberry creme filling which was creamy. the creme inside was not very sweet i would say maybe 50% since i don't like sweets a lot. the outside was and inside layers were so crisp good! i warn you though your shirt will or the area your standing will have lots of crumbs because its so flaky good. next i see pigeons trying to eat my left overs how nice its not going to waste and feeding the hungry. 

i thought to myself i usually don't or crave doughnuts and cronuts, cake, and all that sort of category. now I'm thinking to myself man that sucker was so good i want another one or want to go back and try some. i think its amazing and a should try item while in sf. 

the service was ok and friendly i had observed them telling what it is inside without a snobby like you should know it kind of attitude. the cashier was friendly and seemed like he had allergy with all the sniffling and pink eye as well. also i observed a baker who was cutting the dough so happily bouncing up and down as he's cutting the dough and seemed like he was humming to a jam as well lol. i thought to myself he must really like his job. 

as i am leaving the store is one short counter top facing the street for you to enjoy your cruffin. and on the white wall they have a bright neon pink light say something which i forgot lol something about i got mr holmes baked goods. and a long white seat too for kids or friends to wait for friends but more of a go in go out type of environment vibe.
author: Alex T.

description: Bad service. I asked the guy at the counter for a box since I was getting a few items, but he ignored me and just put my pastries in two bags. Throwing my donut inside with the cream down which got everywhere. Then I asked for a coffee which was barely full and then as I was walking out the lid of my coffee came out, which was my fault. I spilt it all over my hand and the floor. I went to the counter to asked if I could have something to help clean up, but she said that it was fine. I waited there to see if it was possible to get a new coffee then she asked can I help you with anything else and I asked if I could have a new cup of coffee since my first one was broken and she just handed me a new cup, so I just left. The sad thing the people in line were more helpful than the staff.
author: James E.
