description: AMAZING. Every time. 100%. The pastries are so good, and the boxes look super nice for a gift.
author: Catherine C.

description: Nom nom cruffin.  My first bite was unmemorable...then I hit the filling and the gloves were off!!  Very yummy caramelly chocolately thing.  I had the chocolate croissant the next day.  Bf said donut was good.
author: C L.

description: My colleague brought it into work one morning and the chocolate croissant and caramel sticky bun BLEW MY MIND! #bestinSF
author: Halle O.

description:
I'm sure the cruffins are amazing if you want the whole "wait in line and maybe get one" experience.  Weekend mornings are my time to relax and sleep in, not go on a cruffin hunt. 

So my review is based on the other pastries that are available. Some nicely flavored ones and they change up the selection which is nice. But the last time I went, all the pastries were a bit dry and tough, flavor mediocre, and the experience just sucks (by the time you are ready to make your selection is when you are close enough to see the signs, so you are rushed to make a decision). 

If i'm going to travel for a danish and spend money on one, I'm going to b patisserie.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Tasty cruffins (the flavor yesterday was chocolate banana split- yum), and I was surprised when I arrived at 9:45 am on a Tuesday that there were still a few left. 

But the best part were the DONUTS!!!! The almond poppyseed donut was to die for.
author: K. D.

description: Best neon sign. Ever. Croissants are amazing too! Get there early so you can have your choice of all the treats.
author: Marceline K.

description: Get there early or don't bother, the line is long and they may sell out by mid-morning. But delicious donuts with blood orange curd or rose pistachio may be your reward if you are patient!
author: Lynn R.

description: Love this bakery, almost enough to brave the early looooooong line on a regular basis. Creative, delicious baked goods. Try the California roll, who knew a sushi inspired croissant could be so good?!
author: Haley J.

description: Loved everything there! I had the blue cheese and pear danish! I wanted to have the milkshake pastry but ot was already 10AM and they usually run out of that at 8:30AM! Definitely going back to try that!
author: Yael C.

description: Finally woke up early enough to make the trek into the city to get my hands on a cruffin! Holy moly was it cold out! Waited in the 9am Saturday morning cruffin sale line and it was worth it! Super yum in my tum! Had other pastries as well and everything was delish!
author: Tess Y.

description: By far the best croissant I ever had in my life. enough said. Wait in line, it's worth it!
author: Nasser N.

description: Cookies are delicious. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is cause I googled them first and the menu is not up to date. Went in with an order for items they no longer make. But like I said the cookies are awesome!! The staff was very friendly
author: Amy Marie B.

description: This place is better than it looks in all of the blogs posts and Instagram photos! A must visit for any local or tourist in the area.
author: Bijou F.

description: Good place. Has some very unique goodies. However I must say that if you're going to open at 7, open at 7.
author: Elmaneca C.

description:
BURNS AVENUE APARTMENT AT 4330 BURNS AVE, LOS ANGELES CA

It will be a matter of time before I find out if the Manager for this apartment only rent to Filipinos.   All the tenants in this complex are all Filipinos.  We are in the USA and we have to be fair to everyone.  We should not only rent our apartments to people of a certain race or culture.  If America is good to you then give back to all Americans!!!
author: Simone H.

description:
So, called my bestie and told her to meet me outside Mr. Holmes Bakehouse for the cruffin line @ 9am on a Sunday.  We had no expectations for getting one - but we got 4!! :-) 

The cruffin is soooooo worth it. It's flaky, filled (from top to bottom) with cream filling (ours was chocolate w espresso chips) and so good. Its so bad for you but you cannot say no. 

We also grabbed 2 other pastries : Amalie Aman & a bread pudding. Delicious. :-P
author: Minnie S.

description: Didn't gets cruffin but ate the California croissant, chocolate chip cookie, and some artichoke cheese tart. The sushi in a croissant was disgusting. It's definitely overpriced for what you get. B. Patisserie pwns this place.
author: Fatty A.

description: A great variety of yummy pastries. This is one of the best bakeries in San Francisco. The line is always out the door but the service is fast so its worth the wait
author: Lennie G.

description: My friend picked me up some items from this spot at they totally blew me away. Sweet but not to rich which I hate in baked goods. I also loved the box and presentation! Top notch!
author: Blaine S.

description: Overhyped and overpriced. Good option if you're in the neighborhood, but nothing worth going out of your way for.
author: Javi M.

description: Wow, my friend bought some of these and damn they were delicious! I DIDN'T THINK I'd go ape shit for some coffee flavor food but I sure did. Will be back wasting money that won't even go to my butt but my gut!
author: Sweets N.

description: I don't get the hype. The filled donuts and cruffins were the most disturbing pastries I've ever tried. The cream inside tastes way too sweet and they put in too much. I understand that some people like that, but the only way to eat these without gagging was to just squeeze out all that goop. I wish they sold unfilled donuts because other than that filling, the pastry itself tasted fine.
author: Binh P.

description: Thanks for the pubic hair in my donut! Gross! Definitely will never be back to this place ever! Eaters beware!!!
author: Tony V.

description: I really wanted to like this place but the pastries are just too crunchy. I've come twice to give it a second chance but even the plain croissant is not great... I honestly would prefer a la Boulange croissant over it because when you bite down it just shatters into tiny pieces, rather than soft layers of flakes. I would be willing to come back and try it again...
author: K M.

description: The matcha cruffin was EPIC. Five stars for dayyyyys...
author: Cameron S.

description: Excellent pastries , savory and sweet equally impressive. Mesmerizing variety
author: Mike L.

description: So, of course I have to try everything. The two BEST pastries to come here for are the DONUTS and the CRUFFIN. Everything else was okay and nothing to really write home about. You must come between 8 and 930 am to even try and secure a CRUFFIN because they run out really fast. Btw, Cruffins come out at 9 am, so it's best to get in line around 845 am. Good luck folks!
author: Ny H.

description: Mr. Holmes is excellent!  He is so nice and generous.  The food is also really good which is why I went there in the first place but the best part was to meet Mr. Holmes.  Next time I'm gonna try the pretzel dog.
author: B. R.

description: Holy crap, this bakery is amazing. Had the caramel- lavendar filled donut and it was DELIGHTFUL. Plan on coming back to try the other deliciousness they offer, NEED a cronut!
author: Sarah A.

description: Not worth the hype!! Too sugary couldn't finish after an hour in line. White hot chocolate flavored cruffin is what we had. Go on a rainy day for shorter line.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I have been to Mr. Holmes Bakehouse twice but I haven't tried his famous 'cruffin' yet. I'm not absolutely dying to try one and if I ever get lucky enough to get one - great. If not, that's perfectly fine, too.

I've tried three pastries: croissant, a cherry danish, and an artichoke danish. All were delicious, flakey, and 'light'. 

What I really like about Mr. Holmes' pastries is his technique. He meticulously layers paper-thin dough upon layer giving his pastries a very layered and unique look. It's tempting to eat layer by layer while eating the pastry, but that would take a very long time considering how many layers are in one pastry, and you'd also be missing out the experience of his goods. I think by doing the layerings makes the pastries crispier. 

I also like that he isn't afraid to experiment and try new things like having an artichoke danish. I don't think I've ever seen an artichoke danish elsewhere, but I knew I had to try it when I saw it. 

If you're like me and hate dealing with crowds, going in around 1:30 pm on a weekday is great. The only downfall is the lack of pastries and baked goods, but that's my own fault for not waiting in line at 7 am. :)

Also, one of the workers told me they only make ~30ish cruffins a week. Yes, a week! Or was it a day? I don't remember.
author: K. E.

description:
sooo good! 

I think fundamentally it is the crust. The buttery, crispy, feathery crust. It's the basis for all their wonderful pastries - sweet an savory. The cruffin is delicious, again the crust. The artichoke pastry is delicious, again the crust (the artichoke was good, but not as great as the ...crust). The almond pastry was delicious, again the crust.

Was it worth the wait? well, I have to admit, I have never waited - fortunately my co-worked lives right down the street and brings them to work.

I think it is better than some other bakeries in the Mission. Though I think Knead Patisserie is equally delicious without the line.
author: Madison W.

description: The cruffins are really delicious, me and the hubby love them. In fact, we "get baked" at Mr. Holmes Bakehouse about twice a week. The staff knows us by name and has our order ready by time we get to the pay point. Great service.
author: Doris G.

description:
Read about this place in the SF Gate, Mercury News and the NY Times. Even heard an earful from my dad "Dude, I heard it's a good place and it's recipes were stolen, gotta grab me a cruffin sometime" Okay dad, I get it. 

Quite a wait at 7:15 on Saturday morning, but for my pops I'll buy every cruffin this place can make...and I guess from what I read, it's a three day process. Two girls were standing awkwardly outside in spandex and uggs, each with a Starbucks in hand and the very first in line. More basic then the most basic can possibly be basic. I guess they found it funny I took a lyft to the tenderloin at 7am and one proceeded to snicker at me as I got of the car. All good, the one who laughed looked like a horse anyways. Fed her an apple out my hand, brushed her mane and continued on. I got in the main pastry line (read: non cruffin) and luckily I was number 6. I bought a slew of various pastries like a fattythen I quickly switched to the cruffin line, naturally. Saturday is cheat day and I don't play around with these clowns..I go hard, considering how clean I am during the week. Anyways, I was number 5 in the cruffin line. These holmies indicate cruffin availability by handing out stickers to people in line...if you receive one, you're guaranteed two cruffins and a slap on the ass (optional, I opted out). There is no set menu, so you can't pick what you're gonna order beforehand, which is good because you're way too predictable of a person anyways. I was a bit disappointed to see that the cruffin flavor was strawberry milkshake, but needless to say, I devoured my cruffin like Babe Pig In The City (that's the sequel, you uncultured vegetarian). Also made friends with a geneticist in line and his cute three year old son. Cool guy and he was all about the cruffin, bout that cruffin, no treble.

I forgot to mention everything I ate was delicious and all the employees were very friendly. Probably pretty important to note;)
author: Michael K.

description: Definitely worth the wait! I've been dreaming of the cruffins and coffee for months!
author: Maggy G.

description: Can't put into words how good the cruffin was. I actually never went there, but my friend did and just brought the box of goods to me (thank god).  She said the line was long, there was also a 2 cruffin limit and they were released right at 9am.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
This review is more on their business model than on their actual products. I admit, the cruffins are to die for. Most other stuff is great as well. The salted caramel cream doughnut is a little to strong for my taste. 
My problem is that they make you wait in that long line and you are limited to what you can buy. They are purposefully keeping their supply low to create this frenzied demand for all the lemmings willing to wait. 
Heaven forbid you are next in line and the last cruffin is sold to the person in front of you. You wait an hour and then nothing. They should know now much inventory they have for the day and go out and estimate who in line will probably not get what they want. Easy! I'll go sometime again when the fuss is died down or maybe when all the other bakeries are making cruffins.
I would recommend B. Patisserie on California and Divisadero. Voted best bakery in the U.S.
author: Michael W.

description:
i've had a few things here. all were crazy delicious.

i think their filled donut surprised me the most. the not-too-sweet, intense, dark caramel filling was so delicious.

their cruffins are delicioius, as everyone says. definitely try one if they're available.

love the cheeky attitude of this place.
author: Shawn C.

description: Come for the novelty cruffin (which is basically a very well made and delicious Morning bun with filling) and return for the cookies. Best in SF.
author: Mick H.

description: Loooooove everything they sell here! 4 stars because I wish they had a bigger location, wish they sold more cruffins and you could get more than 2, and they had a bit less sugar on them. The workers are super nice though and I love the atmosphere-it's also one of the most instagrammed and a go-to when in San Francisco
author: Amir G.

description:
donut was good.

but heres a thought....why not make more cruffins? 
more cruffins = more $$$ and happy people.

otherwise your offering the latter.
author: Jason C.

description: So delicious I think I gained 5 lbs from everything I tried. I still NEED to try to the cruffin, but I would go back and have everything, because not one thing is bad. 4 stars because I don't believe in waiting in line!
author: Morning S.

description: So overrated. The cruffins are not worth the hype. The pastries were mediocre. I wanted to love Mr. Holmes so bad. We got 6 cruffins but only ate 2 and left 4 to rot in our kitchen counter. The dough wasn't tasty and it was burnt. The filling was alright. Tried the callifornia roll and the salmon was overcooked and salty. The donuts were horrendously disappointing, could've gotten a better one from those 24 hour donut shops. Will never return.
author: Jane W.

description: Got there later so didn't get to try their infamous cruffin. Got the Choux bomb (with hazelnuts), it was pretty good, had the perfect amount of sweetness with some salt in the pastry to counter act it. But I didn't feel the need to get here in the morning for it. Also got one of their savory croissants that had salmon in there (like Japanese omusbis) which was also pretty good! It's not the best bakery I have been to though, but a cute nook near the Tenderloin district to try out.
author: Amanda H.

description: Just yum! Get the ham and cheese Danish and of course the Amelie aman. I've had almost everything on their menu other than the cruffins (because no one wants to wait in line twice!) and it's all been fantastic. The hazelnut choux bomb is also great. The filling is so smooth and nutty!
author: Sam L.

description: For the weeks leading up to my actual visit to Mr. Holmes, I gushed non-stop about how badly I needed to try the cruffin - basically the SF equivalent to a cronut. When I finally got up early enough on a Sunday to line up for the cruffin, I had such high expectations for the specialty pastry as the smell of butter and sugar wafted down the street. The flavor of the day was chocolate chocolate chip, and the cruffin itself was filled with a chocolate pastry cream and topped with chocolate nibs. After actually trying it, I think calling it a cruffin is extremely misleading - I was expecting a mix between muffin and croissant in every bite, but it's essentially just a croissant in the shape of a muffin. The outside had a little too much cinnamon sugar for my taste, and the cream was a little over the top. However, the intermediate layers were the best, the buttery and flakey croissant layers with just a hint of the chocolate cream. My favorite thing from Mr. Holmes ended up being the California croissant. An extremely creative idea, the California croissant is a croissant filled with smoked salmon and nori. A savory croissant may seem strange, but somehow the flavors came together perfectly with the salty smoked salmon and the buttery pastry dough. I'd go back just for that, but probably wouldn't line up for the cruffin again.
author: Ashley T.

description: My apartment is a few blocks from Mr. Holmes' Bakehouse, so I was very excited when this place first opened. I've tried several of their items since they opened, including the chocolate croissant, regular croissant, pear danish, and cookies. Although I am a lover of baked goodies, I have to say I was a bit underwhelmed. The pastries were often cold, not super flaky, and weren't flavorful enough for me. Perhaps I'm spoiled after eating lots of French pastries in past years. I'll try to come back another time for their cruffins and see if they're better than the other pastries.
author: Michelle E.

description: I have heard about Mr. Holmes Bakehouse and their awesome cruffins. Though by the time I got there, it was already sold out. While I personally cannot say anything about their cruffins, I can say that they have a delicious array of other pastries that I would not hesitate to stand in line for. Their croissant are is soft, buttery in the center with a crispy sweet shell. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. While the store might not look like much, but walk near it and you can smell why people are willing wait in line for hours.
author: Hao L.

description: Obsessed with the California croissant. Delicious savory croissant with a smoked salmon and seaweed center, surpassed my expectations by a mile! Next time I'll come back I'll try one of the donuts or cruffins...and another California croissant.
author: Allison D.

description: I came here for the cruffin hype but I ended up liking the donut best. So a friend and I came early thinking the line for cruffins would start right after it opened, but there wasn't a line established yet so we bought the passionfruit donuts. Oh man, those were soooo good. Every yummy donut bite was accompanied by a little gloop of passionfruit filling and it was just the perfect combo. A refreshing taste of passionfruit and then a little bit of donut to even out the taste. I would definitely come back for the donut. The cruffin however, wasn't what I expected to be, and a little bit of disappointment. I felt like the matcha strawberry cruffin would've been better with just the matcha, but the berry filling kinda made it taste like croissants and jam, although crispier and crunchier. I much would've preferred maybe hazelnut filling or something. It was pretty expensive, which made me sad, but it's the hype right now so I guess that's how it'd work. The employees here seem to work really hard and are friendly though, so there must be a reason why their pastries are so expensive. Will come back for donuts, but cruffins--not so much. At least I won't have to wait in an hour and a half line next time!
author: Bonnie T.

description: I don't have a sweet tooth but I could finish their cruffin and it was good! Not too sweet and all flaky croissant filled with yummy chai latte custard...hmmm delicious .If you are in the area give it a try!
author: Varsha M.

description: The croissants are amazing. Everything I want in a croissant--buttery, flaky, light. I've tried a few of their specialty ones and they're always tasty. I found the cruffins overwhelmingly sweet due to their sugar coating. I think they would have been delicious on their own. Fun to try, but not worth standing for hours in line.
author: Jen H.

description: As a huge foodie and pastry lover, I'm so glad that Mr. Holmes lives up to all of the hype. I excitedly dragged my sister there at 8:25 this morning and was surprised to see that the line was not as long as I had expected for a Sunday...but the line soon wound around the corner of the street. At 8:45, a staff came out to announce the flavor of the day and pass out stickers to buy the cruffin (2 per person). Once the cruffins came out at 9, the line moved pretty quickly. Today's cruffin flavor was banoffee (banana+coffee+toffee). The wait was totally worth it...the flavor and texture of the cruffins were totally on point. The cruffins had a flaky and sugary exterior and was filled with a buttery and rich cream. The cream was mostly dominated by the bananas, so I didn't taste much coffee or toffee. It wasn't a big deal though, because it was still delicious! I'll definitely be back to try the donuts and their other beautiful goodies next time!
author: Kathleen H.

description: NOM!  These guys and gals make the best donuts I've ever had.  Soft, flakey, creamy, savory, sweet... every sensory organ went into overload as I ingested a cherry-chocolate-cream filled donut.
author: Jon M.

description: Spendy dough. Fillings may or may not be what your expecting. Simple carmel my fave but prepare to wait.
author: Christine T.

description: Most reviews say to come before or by opening to make sure you get your allotment of cruffins. We just couldn't make it happen. We arrived around 9:30am on Sunday just in time to see them distribute the last tray. All was not lost though. We thoroughly enjoyed the Amelie Amann - flaky and perfectly sweet. Banana creme filled donut was outstanding. The ham and cheese pastry was good too. Items are around $4 each. Order 6 pastries to get their cute box. Oh and a note, even though Yelp says this is Lower Nob Hill, it definitely feels like its in the Tenderloin. Parking is usually tough, but Sunday morning parking is easier than other days. If I was in the area I'd come back!
author: Lisa H.

description:
We were craving donuts, found this store through Yelp. Almost didn't attempt to stop by because of other reviewers' comments about the long line. Well, we decided to drive by last Sunday around 11am and see if there was a line. To our delight, there wasn't! 

So I went in and picked up 2 cruffins (flavor for the day was S'mores), a California Croissant and a donut (orange and passion fruit filling I believe). The donut was fresh tasting, but wasn't anything memorable. At $3.50 a piece, it lacked value. My hubby said he California Croissant wasn't special either and that the salmon tasted very salty. And finally, the cruffins. I liked the texture of the cruffins, but apart from the marshmallow sitting on top, there was nothing S'mores about it. The chocolate cream tasted sort of strange - ended up just eating the cruffins and avoiding the filling. Hubby is a big fan of flaky pastry like croissant, but even to him, the cruffins wasn't anything spectacular. I'm actually shocked to read that there's a 2 cruffins per person limit because I can hardly imagine anyone liking them so much that they will buy more than a couple at a time. We feel this is unfortunately a hyped-up place that we wouldn't recommend or visit again.

On a positive but less important note, I really like the little cute pink paper bags with gold lettering that the goodies comes in though!
author: Tanya Y.

description: Extremely tasty, but be ready to wait in line for the cruffins. Hubby waited in line for an hour and was only able to get two since I wasn't there with him! Everything we tried was absolutely delicious. I loved the bread pudding and the scones, but everything was extremely tasty.
author: Chrissy M.

description: Even though I didn't have the opportunity to try to infamous cruffin due to my inability to pull my sad excuse of a self out of bed before 10am. However upon entering the shiny white interior my nasal passages were wooed by the warm embrace of butter that permeated the air. I felt as if I was visiting the grandmother I never had. I ended up getting a Danish and some wild cheesecake toast combo. While I was incapable of moving for the next 30 minutes after consuming these butter laden treats, I had no regrets.
author: Andrew S.

description: Their salted chocolate chip cookies are uh-mazing. I ordered three dozen cookies for an evening event my work was hosting and all of our guests were so excited to find their cookies. I highly recommend Mr Holmes to perk up a party.
author: Nann N.

description: Oh my gatitos!! I can't believe I have lived 5 blocks away from this place for so long and I have never knew it existed! I looove everything, even if my wallet suffers a bit every time I go there. 4+ for a croissant...
author: Ashley W.

description: Came here on a whim after dropping off hubby at work.  I was alone and took my chance and stood in line that was heading towards sutter....luckily that was the one for the cruffins and I was second to last of receiving my golden ticket to just 2 Cruffins.  The flavor of the day was Green Tea Matcha.  Usually not a fan of this flavor, but you cannot deny the freshness, flakiness, and sweet taste of this cruffin. After picking up my 2 cruffins, ran over to the "regular item" line to pick up some more goodies to fill up my box.  I loved the salted caramel doughnut!   Also tried their blueberry square and chocolate chip cookies and they were all so tasty.  It took be about 1.5 hours to do all this...would I do it again? Not in the near future, but definitely would bring a friend if I do.  It's such a crazy experience.
author: Lisa W.

description: I'm not sure if the worker who I encountered today was having a bad day or if it's EVERY day. I'm guessing from her angry demeanor towards me, that it's every day. I ordered a sweet & then stepped over to the register after she tossed it in a bag while having a personal conversation with another worker. Both looked at me without acknowledging me & continued their conversation without even giving me a total. Instead of interrupting these workers from doing the job they're getting paid to do. I held my iPhone out towards the Square payment machine when suddenly the angry worker blurted out "you wanna use google pay?" I said yes & she said "then why didn't you tell us that?". I responded that I didn't want to interrupt the personal conversation she was having with her coworker & she then replied "all you have to do is open your mouth and speak". So, instead I'm now opening Yelp so that everyone else can read what I experienced & hopefully this angry worker learns a lesson that when you're on the clock & there's a paying customer standing in front of her, that you cease all personal conversation & do the job you're being paid to do - serve customers with a smile & use proper etiquette when addressing them, since without these customers, you won't have a job to be angry at paying customers. I told my friends what happened right afterwards & they said they've had similar experiences with this same angry worker & that they try & avoid her since she's always so unpleasant to them too.
author: hot t.

description:
I used to be a big fan; but sadly this place is going down-hill. The selection of savory pastries keeps decreasing; the sausage rolls were great and are now gone.

Too much emphasis on the donuts, with staff always recommending and pushing them. The donut dough is is perfectly light, airy, fresh. However, the donut favors are just ok, always missing that "umph" to make them truly tasty and memorable.

Plain croissants are good. 

Please skip the koign amain and get it at B-Patissrie. The ones at Mr Holmes are always dense, flat (not puffed), dry, and slightly burnt, while the ones at B-Patisserie are amazing.
author: ej l.

description: We went on a Sunday morning and the line was short. 2 minutes. It was so good. I see that they are opening one here in Los Angeles. Yay!
author: Ralph B.

description: I've never been but my co-workers are constantly bringing me goodies from there.  I love the originality in their pastries and I am in love with the sushi croissants.
author: Rose R.

description: life altering goodness! omg! so delicious! amazing!
author: Shannon M.

description: Delicious bakeries. But the location could be different. I didn`t expect to find such a place in that street.
author: Gzde C.

description: There is literally nothing bad that can be said about this place. Getting up at 6am on a Saturday morning and standing in line for an hour and a half to try the coveted cruffin? WORTH. IT. Staff was super friendly too. Also, just check their Instagram to know what flavor cruffin will be available on a particular day so you can wait for a flavor you actually want to try. Go here. You will not regret it. Good god it is SO DELICIOUS.
author: Charlotte P.

description: What can I say about this place other than that I come here at least once a week Their cruffins are to die for and doughnuts are ridiculously good. I just don't like that there is a wait most of the time you come here, smh. So if you want to get a cruffin, come early and it's pretty pricey for a pastry, but you get what you pay for. The hype is real!
author: Q W.

description: I live in the neighborhood. Waited a long time to try a cruffin. Not worth the  wait nor expensive prices. Had other pastries they were forgetable. This is my second review and I'll write a 3rd if need be. Someone from this company got my first review removed. I wasn't mean just honest.
author: SF T.

description: I adore their doughnuts- especially the banana  filled. Don't overlook the cookies. The chocolate chip has a dash of sea salt for that perfect combination of salty & sweet!
author: Melissa B.

description: I joined the line at 7:45AM to make sure I was able to get my order of their pastries then went over to the cruffin line which starts to sell at 9:00 AM.  An hour and a half later and I was able to secure all the goods.  I'd do it all over again.
author: Jim S.

description: Even though I'm not a tourist I got shamed into waiting in line for the world famous cruffin. I have to say it was a unique bonding experience with my fellow cruffin tasting line mates. I got to the queue at around 8:15 am for the magical pastry. At about 8:45 to 9 a bakery staff comes out and gives you a pink sticker guaranteeing you will get one of these tasty treats. At 9 am they begin serving. $4.50 for one cruffin, limit two per sticker. I got my cruffin, inhaled every ounce of it, licked my fingers and promptly went into a diabetic coma.
author: Randall H.

description: The cruffin is overrated. I think the donuts and croissants are way better.
author: Elaine L.

description: I ate a lemon cruffin and it was too sour. I am usually a fan of sour pastries but I feel it overpowered the richness of the pastry and powdered sugar. I also tried the goat cheese apple pastry, which sounds like a creative and tasteful combination. Once again, however, I was slightly disappointed by the ratio of 'goat-cheesiness' to the sweetness of the apple. Overall I could tell the pastries were well constructed, but perhaps the flavor balance can be improved ( at least for my palate).
author: George K.

description: Right by my work. I begrudgingly stood in line for a cruffin and it was worth every minute of it. I don't care how cool you are, you are not above the cruffin. The rest of their goodies are amazing too. Cool decor inside, love the neon sign ;)
author: Shayan S.

description: Came today for a coconut cream pie cruffin. Got here at 8:50 AM and there was no line!!
author: Melissa N.

description: Cruffins were out by 11am-never tried one but heard amazing things. Instead I tried the salt caramel filled donuts which were incredible. Great bakery, wish he could expand throughout SF!
author: CHristine J.

description: Overrated and very expensive. You're paying extra prices for the fancy boxes they use for your pastries. Not worth a wait.
author: Judith D.

description: My review is based on the doughnuts only.  I really, really want to love these, but they taste as if they're fried in rancid oil.  I'll try some of the other items and revise my assessment at that time, but rancid oil is a big thumbs-down for me.  Sorry, guys.
author: Earline A.

description: I waited in line for 30 minutes and was pleased to see a large assortment of pastries and Sightglass coffee. I don't know what to recommend... Too much good stuff...too difficult to single any one item out. Worth the wait.
author: Alex B.

description: Cruffins!!! I assume this was SF's response to the NY cronut. They are a wonderful thing, and I was very happy to get myself up bright and early so i could get one for myself. The line was a bit long once I got there right before 9am on a Monday morning. It took about 20 minutes to get in there and get my mocha cruffin! We bought two of those and a savory Danish with artichokes on it, and coffee. We decided to take our breakfast and drive over to Golden Gate Park and have a little picnic by the Conservatory of Flowers! The cruffin's were just as I had hoped. They do taste like both a muffin and a croissant. The inside is filled with a wonderful mocha pudding that was really wonderful. However, I actually think I enjoyed the savory danish even more than the cruffin. I was rather surprised by that, because people line up for the cruffin's every day. Not the savory danish's. Anyway, it's all great. Even the coffee was great. But make sure to get there before 9am if you want that cruffin!
author: William O.

description: There are more than enough reviews raving about this place but just wanted to add another 5 star review. Seriously...delicious. Best time to go is early around 745-8am on the way to work. Bring some pastries into your office and everyone will love you for the rest of the day.
author: Adam W.

description: cruffins=the best ever. our hotel was around the corner (hotel carlton) and i swung by after i read up on good ole yelp! it's worth the wait people!! mint chocolate chip was the flavor of the day. so good, you could tell they used REAL mint, none of that artificial crap! also tried some of the other pastries they had. all in all, i'm a fan of Mr Holmes! all their pastries are on point; perfect balance of flavors and most of all not overly sweet. just the perfect amount of sweetness.
author: Carol C.

description: Snickerdoodles are to die for, kouign amann is delicious, beautiful little shop where everything looks yummy!!!
author: Alice D.

description: Was referred here by a friend who knows I hate croissants. Don't know why I don't like them but one bite and I'm donezo. They sell other pastries and doughnuts (always YES) so we decided to check it out. Got there around 7:30am (30min before opening on a Saturday) to find a few people chatting and hanging out. The crowd was refreshingly not a bunch of young hipster instagrammers but surprisingly diverse! This place is definitely making a name for itself. Got the banana doughnut, a raspberry doughnut, and even tried the cruffin because, why not. Everything was fluffy and delicious. Absolutely loved my raspberry doughnut tho I wish I could've tried a different cruffin. Would definitely come back and try it again, especially if they bring back the cherry or hazelnut cruffins I've heard of!
author: Jamie B.

description: Well what hasn't been said about this place. I don't think i need to go into much detail here. Everything is good! I cannot complain about any of the food items at this place. So why only 3 stars? The trouble you have to go through to get these annoyingly good Cruffins. I personally lined up a good hour and a half before opening...that's around 7am or so on a Saturday folks...only to find out it's one (1) Cruffin per person...no exceptions. That was very very disappointing.
author: Orlando J.

description: A most delicious baked goods place in a not so nice part of town.  We love the unique flavor combinations.
author: Cherridah P.

description: I got baked at Mr Holmes Bakehouse
author: Dominic V.

description: I drove through morning traffic to experience what was pure disappointment.  After purchasing well over $20 with of goods to sample, I was saddened that the cream fillings for the pastries had very little flavor despite the enticing descriptions and catchy names.  The pastry was greasy and heavy.  Maybe it was an off morning.  I applaud and believe in young and independent small businesses, therefore I'll stop in on a later date. Sorry.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Wow...Definitely worth waiting in line for. Had the chocolate brownie cruffin and it was something that everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime

Even if you don't make it in time for the cruffins there are plenty of other delicious options available. The salted caramel donut was spectacular and a big hit at the office.

A very cute store as well. The packaging and branding is all top notch (I am a graphic designer. I cant help but judge these types of things)

Its safe to say I will be coming back soon for more.
author: M T.

description: I went on a friday morning so there was no line, but the cruffins were all gone by then so maybe that's why.  I got a danish and some other pastry and thought they were both ok. I'll have to make a trip back to try the cruffins and the other pastries that look appetizing.
author: A G.

description: Absolutely amazing, I was lucky enough to have a kind co-worker bring some in this morning. I love croissants but these are beyond what I could have imagined--best croissant texture inside and out--plus creamy flavorful fillings.
author: Lucie W.

description: I can't even begin to describe how good this place is! We went at 9:30am on a Friday morning and ordered a little of everything they had. Every single thing was mouth-watering delicious. Also, no line...which is always a plus in San Francisco. Definitely a "Must-Try"!
author: Sarah P.

description: DELISH! Just wish there wasn't a line....ever!
author: jess t.

description: The elusive Croffin! Supply is definitely not meeting demand. For the second time, they ran out of EVERYTHING and it was only 10:30am! We came here especially to get that delicious crossiant/ muffin but again, nothing. Totally disappointed and prob not coming back :(
author: Nori L.

description: Still need to try the cruffin but everything else from here is amazing even though I dont particularly enjoy sweets.
author: Michael L.

description: Seriously one of the best spots for those with a sweet tooth in the entire Bay Area. Had the cruffin and a few of the donuts and they more than lived up to the hype. Definitely recommend provided you don't mind waiting in line for a while or have a friend who doesn't mind waiting in line. FYI - I think the limit is 2 cruffins per person.
author: Ammar R.

description: The pastries were fabulous. I had heard about them on Unique Sweets and decided to try it while on vacation in SF - we tried so many, I cant remember what they were, but the cream filled donut stuck out as one of the best. I wasn't there in time to tries the cruffin, but maybe next time.
author: bimali b.

description: Mr. Holmes is one of my favorite bakeries in San Francisco! I love their California Croissant, which is stuffed with salmon and nori. This is way better than the overhyped cruffins
author: Vhalerie L.

description: Everything here is amazing. The banana stuffed donuts are my fav. Has not tried the stuffed cronuts as they are always out by the time I get there.
author: Brian T.

description: I didn't stop at the actual bake shop but I tried the banana caramel doughnut at Samovar... ridiculously good.
author: Alex V.

description: This is probably one of the best bakeries in town right now.  Tartine definitely has some stiff competition.  If anyone knows me, they know that I will rarely wait in a line and a line for a sweet is absolutely unheard of, except when it comes to this place.  I have had a medley of almost everything they have to offer.  The chocolate croissant is one of the best I have ever had, ever.  The savory stuff is magnificent as well as the fruit filled pastries.  The only thing I can't speak to is the cruffin because it's like the holy grail.  Can't seem to get there in time to get one.  One day......
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Context: Friday at 11am

Atmosphere: basically none. There are some hard, short wooden stools and a counter affixed to the wall but this is not a place to hang out and read your email.
Service: friendly, pleasant and quick

Food: some of the best pastries in the city and really, really excellent croissants. I like a crisp, flaky crust (almost burnt) with a soft but chewy interior and the whole thing is light for its size though not airy of that makes sense. And these were close to perfect. Smaller than bar tartine but more balanced and darker than jane on Larkin or sight glass.  We also tried the vanilla cream brioche donut which was also excellent. I really want the vanilla cream recipe. It's a rich but not heavy custard with strong vanilla notes that is sweet but not cloyingly sweet. The brioche donut is light but chewy. The third thing we tried was one of the best pastries I've ever had (and I try pastries every chance I get). It was a cruffin (I know, I know,  enough with the combined names) but this was excellent. It's a million crunch/flakey cinnamon sugar layers wrapped around a center of strawberry jam and vanilla custard (I have got to get that custard recipe!).  It's almost impossible to eat and very messy but worth all the work and spills. They serve sightglass coffee.
author: Vivek V.

description: Best restaurant in saugatuck.  The staff works like a well oiled machine with a solid repertoire of food.
author: Edo Z.

description: The cruffins are worth trying. It's very sweet and sugary and messy to eat. Their donuts are great too!! Love the passionfruit donut!
author: Julia M.

description:
So.bloody.good.

If you want a cruffin, however, go before they open. They only make 100 and sell out within the hour they open for business.
author: S B.

description: Know the sticker system! When the line is super long, they pass out stickers for cruffin purchases (2/per person).  Two lines, left line for cruffin, right is for everything else.  Got an assortment and everything is delish
author: ngoc l.

description: Incred-edible! This is how you've dreamt Danish should be. This little gem soma is a treasure. We got a box (nice n sturdy) of various delights and every item was absolutely wonderful! I won't bore you with the details. Also offers coffee, et al. Not to be missed.
author: Lou B.

description: Yummy and inventive treats that are waaayy too rich for breakfast but great as a dessert.
author: Brooke G.

description: The cruffins are pretty darn good (I had the plum flavor today) although I probably wouldn't wait in a line for 30 min again (it was worth it the first time!) the other pastries are alright (I didn't try them all) and they seem to have some unique flavors. The one issue I had was with one of the women who works there (she's the one with the greenish-blue hair). She was extremely rude to myself, the other costumers and even the new employee. She was very short with all of us and had a snide remark for pretty much everything. Smile once in a while! That's part of being in food service...
author: Jay L.

description:
This guy is a master at his art.  When he pulls his tuning hammer out of his kit, I know it's going to be as good as my instrument allows.  He's also smart and friendly, that's icing on the cake. 

 I wish i still lived in the bay area. none of the tuners down here can compare.to John Geist.
author: Timothy G.

description: I will not wait in line for it. Got the items to go as there is no room for sitting (except some small stools). I really liked the Cruffin (passion fruit filling). The Chux Carmel was too sweet for me and I didn't care for it.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Due to the personal nature of this review, my name is omitted, but this is a testament to the truly wonderful programs at Varsity House Gym in Old Tappan, NJ, as well as the expertise of the highly educated and skilled staff. Varsity House Gym likely saved my life. 

I am a grandma in my 60s. I joined VHG as a participant in their Six Week Challenge last spring. At that time I was a size 14 with high cholesterol and osteoporosis. My endocrinologist warned me that if I did not lose weight and lower my blood sugar level that I'd have to begin medication for pre-diabetes, which seemed to me like the beginning of the end. I couldn't run, could hardly do a sit up; I was truly out of shape. Witnessing my health deteriorate, I felt like I was in a rowboat without paddles being swept towards a massive waterfall. And then I heard about Varsity House Gym. 

Varsity House Gym does not look like any other gym, and I've been to the best. Apart from the partial football field occupying the center of the facility, flanked by what I've come to call, "serious gym equipment", the kind professional athletes use to train, VHG does not rely upon typical gym machines. 

The Six Week Challenge began with an enlightening lecture by one of the VHG owners, Joe, who taught the Challenge group about healthy eating. I mistakenly thought that I was eating healthfully; organic means nothing if one is eating the wrong organic foods. That lecture alone was a life changer.

Notwithstanding, six months have elapsed. My endocrinologist called me earlier today to tell me that my osteoporosis had improved; I now only have osteopenia, and I hope to do even better in the future.  Moreover, I am down to a size eight, I am no longer pre-diabetic (not even close) my cholesterol is normal and I can run! I didn't even think that was possible six months ago. I am incredibly strong, feel great both mentally and physically, and to borrow a line from Bob Dylan - "I was so much older then, I'm younger than that now." 

Due of the personal nature of this review, I am not revealing my name, however I highly recommend VHG. Members are treated like family and I will likely be able to spend many more years with mine because of the program and expertise of the staff at VHG. 

A grateful Varsity House Gym member.
author: C A.

description: Their selection varies.  The quality excels.  The sweetness envelops, but the price is so SF.
author: Matthew T.

description: Yummy!  On my 1st visit I came too late and missed all the good stuff - donuts & cruffins!  The 2nd time I was able to try a donut.  Everything you should really eat the same day purchased or else you better store it damn well.  I don't think I liked the California croissant as much as I thought I would but the idea is really cool.  Everything was really good, a little more baked then I'd like, just my opinion.  Can't wait to try a cruffin - need to go back.
author: Meredith K.

description: I love pastries, and a lot of the time, I end up complaining that they're either too sweet or not fluffy enough.. but not here!  The cruffin is amazing when it's fresh.  It's like a crispy croissant with some filling, although the filling can be either a hit or a miss.  It just sucks how they don't announce the flavors ahead of time, cause by the time I get there and line up.. I'm gonna claim two cruffins whether I like the insides or not!  And the forrero rocher choux bomb!  Soo goood!  Just beware that they don't always have them first thing in the morning.  I was so sad last time when I got there around 8:15 and they weren't out yet... but after waiting in line for the regular pastries, and then the cruffins.. I wasn't about to line up again.  Although, I should've, because they're just that good!
author: Tina L.

description: Best croissant I've ever had. Not sure what the secret is, but can't wait for store to open. FYI: got this croissant at fifty fifty on Geary and Spruce.
author: Coraly S.

description: Only came for the cruffin.  The line was super long since they start serving them at 9am.  Glad we waited, it was tasty.
author: love n.

description: CRUFFINS (greater than sign) cronuts. I finally made it in time to try one of these puppies. Matcha Green Tea was the flavor and it was awesome. They only serve two per person so don't go solo expecting to walk out with a dozen. The other great thing about this bakeshop is everything else I've had hear is excellently. Their croissants, cookies and custard-filled donuts! The only draw back would be $2.50 a small for drip coffee. It is Sightglass I believe...but still. The lines on weekends are ridiculous. Your best bet is come on the weekdays, but get there early. The service is great. They do a good job of patiently waiting for your order as your brain adjusts to your stomach not being able to taste the Cruffin. They take the time to explain what is what and what is in what. Top Three in my book.
author: Rob M.

description: A must have! Just when you think the art of pastry has died this place turns up and proves you wrong!
author: Emily R.

description:
Very tasty pastries. Ham and cheese Danish was flaky and the ham was really good. Choux bomb was a good combo of textures, crunchy and soft. I also liked that it wasn't too sweet. 

I bought a whole box of croissants. Can't wait to eat the rest!
author: Christine N.

description: Finally tried this place and it did not disappoint. They ran out of cruffins and they only had 2 kinds of filled donuts which is the cherry filled and salted caramel filled. I have yet to try the others but for now I'll have to go with the salted caramel filled donut as my fave. I highly recommend this place. Def worth the drive to SF.
author: Ada S.

description: The passion fruit donut was the best (and only) passion fruit donut I've ever tried!! Although a little pricey at $3.50 for one donut, it was well worth it and if you're a fan of passion fruit or good donuts I would highly recommend trying it.
author: Sean D.

description: Cruffin are good but I like the doughnuts and that California roll croissant candied ginger mmmm!
author: Rhea F.

description: Honestly, really cool and fun place to get insanely good crafts of art that are inventions one has never seen.
author: Jacky H.

description: Smore's cruffin on a tuesdayyyyy. Cruffin Uppppp...On a Tuesday....see that baker over there she chooosssieee. OK so the cruffins are everything everyone says they are. Delicious goodness in your mouth. Warning, don't be over exited and try to eat while walking or in your car YOU WILL MAKE A MESS AND HAVE CRUMFINS ALL OVA. the doughnuts Andre also very good I wouldn't try the Ferrero richer bomb again, it was ok :/. The top tasted and had the texture of Mexican bread - Conchitas and that was delicious! But it's just a pastry with pudding like filling. For thisnline, i'd rather buy something else :p. Must try other flavors!
author: Dee C.

description: This bake house is THE BOMB. I've probably tired everything on the menu (since I work right around the corner) and I've NEVER been disappointed! With their friendly staff, buttery flakey croissants and abundance of baked goods you honestly can't go wrong with anything here!
author: Maria S.

description: Great spot totally worth the wait... I unfortunately came too late to get a cruffin but all of the other pastries were excellent!
author: David D.

description: Delicious and surprisingly so. Classics that I love, done really well. And other stuff that I feel is classic, but is not like anything I've had before. I hear the line is long, so I'll be awaiting another delivery from my friend who let me in on the secret in the first place. Yum!
author: Trixie R.

description: looove their sweets but the line and wait...nooot so much :(
author: she q.

description:
After reading all the great reviews I have to try this place. Trekked from the Richmond District before going to work. 
No line.
Got the California croissant, apricot brioche and two donuts. 
I was looking forward to their cruffin, but there is none this morning. 

Apricot brioche - alrite.
donut with banana fillings - alrite.
donut with lemon meringue fillings was delicious. 
It's alright..... Would I go back?? Maybe with a friend.
I got there at 7:45am and there was no line. Would l stand in line for this place? Hell no!
author: tina M.

description: Mr. Holmes is a fun bakery. It has a great atmosphere, and I wish there were more bakeries like it in the city. Just know that the quality of the pastries does not come close to the taste and texture of what you would find at any corner in Paris. I think the long line outside Mr. Holmes is the result of bakeries being a rarity in San Francisco, but not necessarily the of the pastries themselves.
author: Kate T.

description: I'm hoping to revisit Mr. Holmes. I went Thanksgiving morning and a majority of things were gone. I ended up leaving with a salted caramel donut and it was WAY TOO SALTY! I was bummed because I do LOVE salted caramel everything but this felt like hella salt. Also they do NOT serve espresso here. I asked the cashier if they ever plan to serve espresso and she said not any time soon because they don't have room for a machine. So your best bet is to try an item and get your espresso fix down the street at Jane's but don't forget to buy something at Jane's too because it's hella rude if you don't!
author: Josie C.

description: Never been, but LOVE their branding! live around the corner and there is always a line and they always sell out. It's probably better that I don't get addicted. I'll just admire their taste for design.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Their cruffins are SO DELICIOUS! I tried the the chocolate brownie chunk and it was too good for words! You have to go early and wait in a long line because they sell out of the cruffins quickly! Their other pasteries were pretty good too. I tried their california roll croissant (savory) and I wish I had gotten another one to save for the next day-definitely a must try if you like salmon! Next on my list is to try their ferrero roche choux!
author: Yasmeen H.

description: Get the ube puff. It is perfectly flaky and sweet. There is nothing better in this world.
author: Tanner Z.

description:
We came on a Friday morning to avoid the weekend crowd, but they were already out of the cruffin by 10:30 am. That being said, we got a few other items and liked them all except for the blueberry danish which was nothing special. The mushroom tart was especially fantastic - flaky crust, delicious mushroom filling. We enjoyed the salted caramel donut as well, which was not particularly sweet but tasty nonetheless.
We'd be willing to come back with visitors to the city.
author: T K.

description: So I waited in line and I really did not like the cruffin. It was chocolate cruffin day and it tasted like chocolate pudding in a croissant and I love chocolate but I do not like chocolate ice cream or pudding. Since they have a limit of 2 cruffins I also ordered a couple of other pastries to try and my opinion totally mixed. The croissant was way over cooked and I hates it but the Fererro Rochet Choux was the bomb and the only thing I ate that was really worth the calories, and in reality none of it was worth the wait. So glad I did it while getting my oil changed down the street and had to wait regardless, it just gave me somewhere to be while I waited.
author: Denise L.

description: SO SO good! Definitely worth the hype! At first we waited in line for cruffins, but since we had arrived around 8:50, we weren't guaranteed getting one plus the flavor of the day was Creamsicle so we weren't dying to try it. Instead we waited in the non-cruffin line, and I enjoyed the most fresh and heavenly ham&cheese danish ever!
author: Jenny E.

description: Get there at least a half hour before they open, the line will be long. I as a tourist made the mistake of getting there 1 hour after they opened and there were no more cruffins. I did try a croissant and a their version of a donut and it was all pretty good, just wish I had got a cruffin. Always next time.
author: Latavia K.

description: I binged on Mr.Holmes for a week. I went Sunday, Thursday, and Friday. Their pastries are good, especially that cherry donut! Their chai tea and green team cruffin was alright but their GREEN tea one was SOOOOO good! I think the cruffins are a bit over hyped though. Standing in line for a $4 pastry is a little crazy but hey, I did it so look who's talking. Haha. Here's a tip: weekends are the worst (obvi). I got there at 830 on Sunday and was at the middle of the line and still waited at least 30 minutes. But I got there at 830 on a wed and thurs and I was in the front! So plan ahead people!! PS bring extra money cause your eyes will trick you into buying more than expected.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I can't believe I was scooped on this... but I was walking up Larkin, on my way to TJ's, and I noticed this guy, standing outside the unmarked building, having a bite of something.

And then it hit me... and I asked:
"Where did you get that? It smells *wonderful*!  

And so, I met Ry, and heard about Mr. Holmes, which is opening a storefront at 1042 Larkin, but has been selling wholesale for several months now. Ry then he told me to wait a bit, only to come back with an amazing, crisp-yet-moist and rich plum pastry, with what appeared to be a gelee that the plums were set into. The tartness, the sweetness, the occasional bright mark of tart lemon in the gelee... really, really good. And along with the plum pastry, a wonderful, serious scone. 

The whole experience triggered those times in my youth when I visited England, and had tart fruits and serious scones. Obviously, Ry must have experience with preparing pastries on the continent, but those more northerly, tart, rich, hearty aesthetics were there too. Wonderful! I love Jane on Larkin, but Mr. Holmes' choice of flavors just feels less sterile and more robust. Not just tasty and elegant, but more lively, bold, and indulgent!  

 All I can say is thanks for your kindness and amazing baked goods, Ry... I will be back. With friends!
author: Mark K.

description: Maybe I came on a bad day but I was quite disappointed to see that the cruffins of the day were baked a bit too long and on the darker side. Having waited so long for these I got them anyways only to find that they did taste slightly burnt. The bread pudding was perfectly moist and not soggy at all. Maybe I'll try them again on another trip.
author: Van H.

description: Damnnnnn!?! The donuts and cruffins are so so so good. Their fillings are all perfect. Something else I love is that their pastries are not too sweet or too rich. Ok...I'm gonna say it...best in the city - no doubt. I HATE that this place is 2 blocks away from our office. Going to mr. Holmes is starting to becoming an addiction!
author: Laura Z.

description:
Well, these are sweets and we should not indulge but...their pastries are really good! I went in by around 12 pm - the most raved about goods were gone but I got an assortment of what was left. Even a croissant is better than the average croissant you can get anywhere else - the pastry itself has a different quality to it and it is not very sweet...just the right taste and texture!
So, yes, I do not indulge in sweets but if I have a sweet I will chose theirs over many others!
author: VIORICA C.

description: Stumbled upon this gem on opening day - absolutely delicious baked goods...each item was honestly better than any I've tried in SF!  I had some amazing pastry that had just come out of the oven and it was heaven.  Not to mention a view of the kitchen area is stunning.  Seriously stunning.  This place is a new favorite!
author: Lorri H.

description: Cute and small place. Very sweet pastries. Too sweet for my taste but I can understand why people love it.
author: Diana G.

description: Just over one year ago, I was staying at the Hotel Carlton and I walked out first thing in the early morning to get a cup of coffee. As I looked both East & West to see which way I would venture out, three women came walking up the hill, all with with coffee cups in their hands, one carrying a large white box, and all of them were sporting smiles.  "Excuse me ladies, is there a good coffee place nearby?"   "Oh my God!! Are you kidding?! Bakehouse is right around the corner!! Go down, turn left and follow your nose!!"  Being a respectful lad, I did as told and I found Nirvana clad in white subway tile and wafting a heavenly aroma!!  "What you like today?"  "Please pick two of your best sellers and a large cup of java" I responded.  Chocolate croissant and a strawberry donut-ish creation were handed to me.  Perfection!! The butteriness, the flakiness, the smooth chocolate taste was amaze-craze!  Coffee was flavorful and full of punch.  Cannot wait to go back.
author: JP L.

description: My favorite treat in SF. People wait outside for the cruffins, which came out around 9:00am on a Thursday morning. We got lucky and stumbled in on PB&J Cruffin day....hands down, best pastry treat I've ever had. Perfect combination of flavors...My advice? Get two and don't feel ashamed when you eat both of them in one sitting. I could have eaten an entire box if they let me.
author: Kelly G.

description: Yum, yum, yum. After hearing a co-worker's excitement about Mr Holmes (even though she'd never actually been), I stopped in before work and picked up an assortment of treats for my co-workers.  They didn't last long!  Will definitely be back to pick up more tasty treats.  I'll have to brave the post-9am crowd to try the cruffins, too.
author: Christine K.

description: I didn't get to try their cruffins but I was equally excited for their pastries because I had read good reviews. Unfortunately I was quite disappointed but also not surprised that this iss yet another place hyped up to 4 stars as so many are in SF.  I tried nearly all the pastries they had that day - kougin amann, bread pudding, sticky bun, doughnuts. Nothing I had was impressive, they were all just OK. The bread pudding was the worst, the bread seemed like it was smushed into the cylinder shape they wanted leaving a gelatin-like chewy texture that was unappetizing. The doughnut was better as it was fluffy, the fruity filling was better than the cookies/cream one. Everything else - kougin amann, danish, and croissant - wasn't flaky or soft enough as it leaned more towards the drier side as if they had baked all of them for too long.
author: Alli S.

description: Amazing! My favorite bakery in the city right now. The donuts are a must try. The creams filling is sweet but not overwhelming. I arrive to the shop at 7:30 to find a line, if you are planning of wetting a croffin, you need to arrive by 8am. The line was pretty efficient and the employees were friendly.
author: Elba A.

description: I LOVED their cream filled donut but thought that the savory pastries were just okay. I would definitely go back for the donuts.
author: Amy N.

description: We went yesterday and luckily we got there early, we were 5th in line :) Got some pineapple mango cruffins and some donuts & pastries!  Every single one is delicious, so full of flavor.  Cruffin was perfect, crispy and flaky outside soft in the inside.  A bit pricey though. The place is a quite small, but  I like that it's clean, despite the environment.  All the employees at the front were very pleasant and friendly.  One lady customer dropped her pastry on the ground as she exited the place (uh-oh!), but no worries -- the ladies were quick to offer a replacement, at no charge!  That was really very nice of them.  Made my day!
author: Jay C.

description: Mr Holmes Bakehouse's slogan is "I got baked in San Francisco." It should be "I blow every other Bakehouse in the Bay Area out of the water." Every piece of dough they touch turns to gold. From their California croissant (sushi California roll baked into a croissant with soy sauce) to their custard filled donuts to their Danishes you can't pick a wrong one. Their flavors change daily, so basically you can't go too often. I recommend that you choose at least six items to get your baked goods in a box. If you order five or less, they are put in bags. Fine, but clearly not the same experience. Although I've been over twenty times, I've yet to time visit to get a long sought over cruffins. Somehow, I don't feel bad about that when I have a chocolate bacon fat stolen or pear and blue cheese Danish. Their donuts are melt in your mouth perfect. The earlier you get there the better, as when they sell out they close. Keep in mind that although they open at 7 am, the cruffins aren't available until 9 am. Over the weekend they have two lines, one for Cruffins (where you can order other items) but if you aren't in the cruffins line you can't order one. Good luck, may the force be with you.
author: Victoria O.

description: Long lines but definitely worth the wait I give it four stars because of the long wait. The CRUFFINS  super delicious!! They  aren't ready till 9am which they don't mention when you call - I recommend arriving at 7:30 or 8 AM if you want to be one of the first five people in line.
author: Amy E.

description: Simply Amazing. I just wish there was a possibility of trying a cruffin without having to wake up at 6 am and wait in line for 2+ hours! I've had the donuts on several occasions and they are also amazing - especially the passion fruit curd and the salted caramel. Also, I bought one of their clever bags to haul my donuts away in and now I use it every weekend for groceries. Win/Win.
author: Libby T.

description:
Just had one of Mr Mr Holmes' muffins at another coffee shop, and boy was it good. I had to ask them where it was from and they told me about about Mr Holmes. Truly one of the best muffins I've had in my life, and I'm a pastry-lover.
I will waste no time in getting to visit the actual bakery!
author: Roy F.

description: Very friendly staff, pastries were decent but nothing to rave about. The coffee was terrible though. I had to add 4 packets of Splenda and cream and still managed to toss it after a few sips. I got the plain croissant (delicious), blueberry and white chocolate brioche pastry (yummy) and a salted chocolate chip cookie which was very good too. We went around 11:30ish and the line was only a few people, super upset I missed out on their infamous croissant/muffin but hopefully next time I can snag one!
author: Nikki S.

description:
Mister Holmes Croissant,
Best pastry I ever had,
Crunchy and toasty. 

Haiku by Jenny
author: Jenny C.

description: My dad brought home these delicious pastries and they were super good especially the strawberry cream cheese pastry they had.
author: Imara W.

description: Amazing!!! This place has absolutely the best  croissants and the like in town -- possibly on the west coast. The salmon sushi one is surprisingly balanced as well.
author: Jos C.

description: Very nice plase i loved .i come evety day ,
author: Valentina T.

description: If I could, I'd eat here everyday. I think the citrus oatmeal cookie probably the best cookie I've ever had. Its really cute inside. I wish it was big enough to have seating. I love that they carry Sight Glass Coffee as well. If you like smoked salmon, get the California Croissant. It is life changing. It is dangerous being around the corner from my house, trying to keep my girlish figure.
author: Kaylie P.

description: After seeing this bakery mentioned in a TV show (Unique Sweets?)  We put this place on our bucket list. We drove into the city this morning (from San Ramon) to primarily try the cruffins......their baked goods were tasty, HOWEVER the service which we received from the young woman who was assisting us (as well as expected a tip)  was impatient and awful. 6 Cruffins 4 Danish and not so wonderful service. $38.50.
author: Donna W.

description:
Kudos to Wire Nutz  Electrical in Vancouver WA

I recently contracted them to set up an RV 30 amp Power outlet from my Main Breaker box in my Garage to an outside location.
Mike the Electrician they sent out arrived Punctually and immediately went to work (in the 100 degree heat) on installing a water proof outlet and Plug in receptacle
He also fixed my Flag light so I can display "ole Glory" like she should be at Night.
I would definitely contract with them again in the Future for all of my Electrical needs
Very Professionally done at a reasonable Price!
author: Kirk H.

description: I skipped the cruffin line (no patience here), so can't tell you how that works. But if you see the cruffin line and just want coffee or non-cruffin goodness, you can walk right in without the wait. My chocolate croissant was yummy! Next time, I'll order something more adventurous or hire a Task Rabbit to stand in that cruffin line for me. ;)
author: Anne C.

description: Of course had to stop by cause of all the talk about this place. Got there about 45 min before opening and was the first ones in line. Decided against waiting longer for the cruffins and opted for just a box of the other pastries. Good, tasty, but worth 4.50+ per item.? No. A box of 6 pastries was a bit over $25. What I still laugh about was here was a cup of peace sign pins, their shop symbol, sitting on the counter I was going to take one thinking they were free but then noticed the number 9 on them so I thought 9 cents but better ask the cost. The lady said they are $9.?! * insert laughing with tears emoji here * uh what? $9 for a lapel pin the size of my fingernail? Any how it's a hipster place that you gotta try once to say you did.
author: Amber R.

description: I would like to give the Red Roof Inn in Syracuse, NY a big kudos. Their rooms are clean, lovely, tastefully decorated, their prices are not inflated AND, the most important of all, pets are free. Anyone staying in a Red Roof Inn, who has a furry friend accompanying them might want to show the hotel the respect they deserve by cleaning up after any accident your furry friend has that, more than likely, is due to your negligence in not taking them out when they needed to go. A motel right next door which, in my opinion, was a s$%hole, didn't accept animals at all, so what does that tell you? At one hotel we stopped prior to finding the Red Roof, charged over $200.00 a night plus $75.00 for pets (inflated price plus an arbitrary theft charge for the dog). Obviously, they didn't get our business.
author: Rebecca S.

description: What a treat! Had a banana cream and caramel filled donut. It was out of this world delicious! Also tried the mushroom and cheese Danish which was super yummy! My only request would be for a couple of "vanilla" offerings (like an unfilled donut or fruitless and nutless muffin) for those who accompany their more adventurous friends to this delightful eatery.
author: Heather M.

description: Their baked goods are delicious, but the line for the cruffins is so long!  I loved their savory pastries! It's difficult not to order at least one of each item, but, beware if you do... it gets *really* pricey!!
author: Annie W.

description: I went to Mr. Holmes yesterday very late in the day, and all they had left was the key lime cruffin. I don't like key lime but I ordered it anyway and was pleasantly surprised with how delicious it was. There was a slight crunch on the outside with a spectacular soft and fluffy inside. I can't wait to try the other flavors. Thank you for the service as well!
author: Suzane D.

description: Great bakery! Loved the mushroom sumac Danish, sightglass cruffin, and the aman. Fillings were all really flavorful w/o being too sweet or sticky. Crusts were crisp and flaky. Keep it up Mr. Holmes!
author: Chelsea F.

description: Well made, expensive pastries in a tiny, takeaway shop in the loins of the 'loin. Most are so rich and sweet (many are filled) that they'd be more appropriate for dessert than anything you might want for breakfast. If paying $5 for a few sugary, buttery bites of puff is your thing, you might dig this place. I don't un-dig it, or de-dig it, I just don't dig it. Dig?
author: Nick C.

description: Another place that tries to be cool by taking their time and making you wait.  They want a long line so people think what they have is extra special.  Nothing I had tastes extraordinary.  Had the chocolate croissant and the turkey pesto Danish.  Not worth the wait in line, feel ripped off.
author: Alan P.

description: The food is absolutely delicious! The cruffins and donuts are worth the line. However when I went the person who "helped" me was a very rude purple-haired girl. Her rudeness really turned the entire experience into a negative one.
author: Fabiana C.

description: so good! the lines can get long though and they sometimes sell out but I would say it's worth the wait
author: Emma T.

description: So my sister I flew over the bridge getting there after seeing some pics on IG. We arrived around 30 min before closing on Friday.. I wish we would have read the reviews closely before arriving. In any event... We arrived and were rushed to pick what we wanted. (In hindsight, I shouldn't have ordered anything). Of course the cruffins were gone but we decided to choose other items because we drove over right away and didn't want to leave empty handed. The gentleman that helped me was really awesome and basically told me when to come, what to purchase and what the best items are. I ordered bread pudding, chocolate cookie and pear and blue cheese pastry. The woman that was behind the counter was exceptionally rude. She totally rushed me out of the way and yelled at her co worker about how she had to help other customers and how the line was getting long. (my sister had just completed her order, she was behind me and there was one person behind her. We had probably been there all of 6 min at this time). The gentleman that was helping me also mentioned to her (in a low voice, don't be rude) She followed that by saying that there is a line and she wanted to keep it moving. Customer service...He received an A and she obviously received an F.  IDK if I'm even interested in returning. The items that I bought were OK. I wouldn't pay to cross the bridge to get them. I am sure there is somewhere in Oakland that I can go to. Maybe one day I'll either go back or find another place with them. Making them from scratch is such a daunting task.
author: keenia b.

description: Came on a Thursday morning 30 minutes before the cruffins come out. Although the bakery opens earlier, cruffins don't come out until 9am. Got my hands on 2 cruffins by 9:15 or so, and they were delicious. These are essentially croissants made in muffin forms but nevertheless good. Worth getting some if you go on weekdays but probably not on weekends. Their other baked goods are just as good as well! Probably made from the same dough.
author: G C.

description: This bakehouse is close to where I live but never tried until recently. Finally went in and got a bunch of desserts. All of them were good. For some popular items there is a line but for others you can just walk in (until supplies last!!!). Highly recommend. Will go again.
author: Yousuf M.

description: High end pastry place. The sushi croissant is really good. In my head it tastes weird, but when I tried it was delicious. Croissant itself was flaky, buttery, and rich. Somehow it works with the soy sauce. Will be back to try the other stuff.
author: Matthew P.

description: I was one of the first in line for cruffins at 8:30am, as suggested by the staff the last time I was here for other pastries. At 9am the staff came out and told us they were running 20min late. Would've given up but I've already been waiting 30min. At 9:20am, they claimed another 10min. It's now 9:39 and still no cruffins.  I'm sorry, but this is just BAD SERVICE and POOR BUSINESS. If you're going to have people wait outside for cruffins, you better have them ready at 9am.  If this were a restaurant and you waited more than 40min for your food to come out, you'd be giving bad Yelp reviews. I'm only being fair.
author: Riz W.

description: Some of the pastries are very good and they also have some original flavor pairings (hazelnut cream choux with a piece of salt and rosemary caramel, a little on the sweet side, their chocolate glazed cruffin, and the sushi- filled are really original and good and some other just regular and I wasn't blown out of the water. What I also liked is that the tiny bakery has a very actual design, cool containers and nice staff. What I didn't like is the crazy crowd fighting for every piece of pastry and overall unpleasant. I know in some places it's a strategy to draw in clients but it shouldn't be what you come to a bakery for. You come to experience pleasure and relaxation and not to witness people snatching croissants from each other :-) So overall only 3 stars
author: Aga K.

description: I've been here twice each time about 10 minutes before opening. No lines, but also no cruffins. They package the pastries nicely in a sturdy box that keeps well ... They also have some counter space at the Work Shop Cafe in the financial district.
author: Anmay K.

description:
Ordered chicken, broccoli Alfredo over ziti today from Alfredos. Came in 40 minutes. Driver was friendly.
Came with two pieces of warm bread.
The food was great. Hot, creamy Alfredo sauce. Topped with parmesan cheese.
Seemed pretty fresh. Will order from them again. Well done.
author: Sam N.

description: We got there at about 11 & there was one pastry left. We tried it & it was delicious!! Wish we could have tried more & the famous cruffin but they sell out very early in the morning.
author: Emily W.

description: Went in Tuesday morning at 10:30, and the cruffins were sold out by 10. I picked up a banana donut, artichoke Danish, and choux bomb. Took the pastures to Lafayette Park and chowed down. Flaky crust on the Danish, a good savory sidekick to the sweeter pastries. I like less granulated sugar on the outside of my donut (and all over my face), but the creamy banana filling made up for it. If you like hazelnut, choux bomb is full of it...maybe a little too much pastry cream to get a comfortable mouthful in without squeezing most of it out. Paid $15 for 3 pastries. I'd listen to the other Yelpers and stand in line (or go before 10) to score a cruffin and a savory Danish. Follow their instagram to know what flavor will be served!
author: Sarah L.

description: Line out the door at 9:45 on Saturday morning.  No Cruffins after 10 minutes and had to go to the back of the "everything else "line.  Everything else is just breakfast pastries, no "breads".  Chocolate croissant and custard donut were exceptional, service exceptional (they told me Janes on Larkin had the dinner bread I wanted.  Coffee was passable. I would not stand in the line again, but would proceed to Janes for variety options.
author: E S.

description: Way overpriced and the quality is the same as the stuff you'd find at a good bake sale.
author: Soup N.

description: Oh god...safest most delicious sex ever. They even have gluten free options. Trust me ...serious yum
author: Palermo B.
