description: Tasty treats!  Will definitely be back here.  There was a bit of a line and things do sell out fast...just a heads up!  It closes early.
author: Lenni R.

description: So delicious.  I've never been inside the establishment. I've had two flavors hazelnut and chocolate.  Both were excellent.
author: Chris P.

description: While everyone else is reviewing the Cruffins, I have a different product. I do not wait in line for much, least of all pastries, no matter how good. And especially when an artificially created supply "problem" is the cause of the line. I'll be alive long enough to try Cruffins when they are no longer the rage. No, I'm reviewing the Chocolate Chip cookies which were delivered by Uber. They are $3 each. Background: I got a free Halloween sugar cookie from Batter Bakery (also by Uber) which was fantastic, so I went to get a chocolate Chip cookie at the Kiosk @ Calif & Kearny. It was great, just as good as the sugar, but was $3.50. That one was about 50% larger than say a Mrs. Fields. Not a great value, but a truly great cookie. The next day Mr. Holmes had their cookies at $6 for 2, so I decided to take a shot as they were a little cheaper. I was not disappointed. The cookies are HUGE! They are twice the size of Batter's (making them 3X as big as a Mrs. Fields) And their are a near-perfect consistency, crispy edges and exterior and chewy interior. They are a hair less good than Batter's, but the best hands down are from Kako (which I don't think you can get anymore.) I'd rate the Holmes cookies at about a 4.5 out of 5 for the quality and the best value for a gourmet cookie you can get in SF. But I did nick the bakery itself another half star for the line "problem" stated above. I heard about this in NYC about a year ago and was appalled that people would wait in line for an hour to get a pastry. While I'm all for a business maximizing its profit, I, myself, will not be inconvenienced in addition to paying premium prices for a product. One or the other, brother.
author: Jeff S.

description: I was so excited when this place opened.  After trying out all of their items I am disappointed. I found most their baked goods overly sweet.  The filling is just too much for my taste.  So far I am only sticking with their savory items.
author: Mei S.

description: The Passion fruit guava donut was good, though it was so sweet I had to squeeze more than half the filling out to have a pleasant eating. The sweet Danish was just okay, I like that it's very flaky and the apples were fresh but in terns of flavour it's not very interesting.
author: Evanes N.

description:
4.5 cruffin line is separate.  limit 2 per person, starts at 9 AM.  stickers given out to guarantee availability in first hour and then sold out.  was a one hour line and gone by 10 AM on a weekend.  box is free if filled with at least 6 items, non round number prices. overall bakery is nice, didn't surpass B patisserie in my book.
basically the cruffin is like layered like a softer sfogliatella spiralling upright like a muffin and covered in sugar, tasting more like a morning bun than a croissant muffin.  was filled with a nice coffee chocolate cream on top like a cream puff combined with chocolate bits
given the cream though, you have to eat it right away or the layer are softened by the end of the day.  I think it could use a little less of the cream but it was good.
amelie amann more compact with caramelized sugar on bottom but tasted nice.  not as layered and puffed like B patisserie.
the donut choices were strawberry, passionfruit, marsala -- filled with custard and doused in sugar.
a california croissant (savory) was interesting with salmon plus seaweed and wasabi and topped with furikake but a little too salty.
brioche bomb with blueberry inside.  best to balance so don't pick too many items with sugar on the outside.
also tried the chocolate chip cookie in seoul and it was amazing.
author: Rob C.

description: Tried out the Earl Grey Tea Donut and as a tea lover I felt like it was lacking the tea essence to it. Honestly tastes like a custard donut to me. But overall, pretty good! Would come again to try their other flavors!
author: Lin M.

description: I bought an INCREDIBLE array of pastries for my colleague's birthday... was really blown away by presentation, staff, technique and taste...  Bravo. Bravo.
author: Lucy B.

description: Pastries were so good, I couldn't save them for the person I bought it for! I bought 3 different types of pastries, thinking of having one in car for brunch, saving the other for later, and giving one to a friend. As I started eating in the car, I ended up really enjoying the first, inhaling the second, and later found myself guiltily polishing the 3rd one off as my meter expired. They are a bit pricey, but totally worth it as a treat.
author: M S.

description: After a horrible chocolate croissant at Dolce Amore nearby, I pulled up the "nearby" section of Yelp on my phone, and happened upon this place. Hubby and I surveyed the goods and saw an extremely promising chocolate croissant and the Ferrer Rocher Choux pastry that is featured in so many pictures of this place. We got them both, and they didn't disappoint. I actually think my eyes may have rolled back into my head as I bit into the chocolate croissant. This is a place that has the laminating right on, and isn't afraid to bake a croissant until it's a nice golden brown. This chocolate croissant was flaky, yet tender, and flavorful. Everything it should be. I dare say I found a chocolate croissant to rival my favorite one at La Farine. In fact, Mr. Holmes' chocolate croissant may just be a little better (sorry, La Farine!). The choux pastry was also wonderful and I've already raved about this place to 2 friends. I will definitely be coming back here. Too bad they were all sold out of cruffins when I went, would love to give those a try too. Maybe next time!
author: Goldi J.

description: So so good! The building I live In hosted a party and had Mr Holmes cater it. All I can say is now I walk almost everything other weekend to this place (40 min) just to get Anything that they are serving.. Wow
author: Eva A.

description: Get here early, because there is always a line!!! They are open until they sell out, but sometimes they sell out by 10 or 11am!!! The jelly filled sugar donuts are awesome, and so are the cruffins! Something I also like about this place is the variety and diversity of flavors, they are always changing things up and adding new flavors/recipes to the mix! If I had any criticism, its that they should continue to make baked goods ALL DAY LONG rather then till they sell out!!
author: Moran G.

description: Ok, so it's tasty. I am a physically fit person, and I "accidentally" ate two of these pastries instead of one. I then went into some weird sugar coma where I had to lie down for several hours. This has never happened to me before. It hurt. I think they've gone overboard with the sugar and heavy cream.
author: Naomi W.

description: If you are vulnerable to temptation try to walk past this place on the other side of the street because the smell coming out of it is very heavenly.  We had a cream filled doughnut and a scone and both were absolutely delicious. There are doing some very interesting and unusual flavor combinations but also have traditional too.  Definitely worth a try!
author: Eric H.

description: I have been hearing about this place for a wile now and have walked by only to find that the line was way too long, and I'm not that much of a sugar fan witch is probably why I don't the like cruffin that much.  It may have been the filling witch was Coconut and lemon, but really, the other stuff was better I liked the savory pastry, but I've tasted better. the staff was really nice.  Overall I might try it again with a different filling.
author: Sara J.

description:
We walked by this bakery before and saw a line out front every time.  Although we live in the Bay Area, we were not familiar with Mr Holmes.  Thanks to the glorious reviews, we decided to stop by the place today.   I am not quite sure what one of the reviewers was talking about when he/she wrote about the bakery's aroma in the air a block away.   All I could smell was the homeless' pee on Larkin.  But this review is not about that.    We did not have the privilege of tasting the infamous cruffins.  In facts, we did not have the privilege of tasting anything that were mentioned in the reviews.   The only things available at 1:00 PM on a Sunday were a few savory danishes and some chocolate chip cookies.   When asked if more were to be made, the answer was "No".  Usually, everything is sold out around 3:30.  Because of the holidays, it was earlier today.   I hope the manager takes note and changes the store throughput to better serve its customers.  Or perhaps, this is the strategy to hype up the business.  
Ok, back to my purchase - what a difficult decision to make since we had such a wide selection of two items.  Cookies or danishes?   We settled for two danishes for $4.50 each.   Let me tell you, I regretted paying that much money as soon as I bit into one.  It was so dry and tasteless.  The danish tasted like it was made yesterday and left in the open until the time I picked it up.   
People, if you want to find out what the hype is all about, go ahead and get in line for some over priced pastries.   For the rest of you, just keep on walking.  You won't miss out on a whole lot.
author: Kim T.

description:
This review is from St Franks Coffee Shop that servers Mr Holmes donuts and muffins.   I have had three donuts and two muffins and all have been exceptional.  Unique flavors that sound a little crunchy like --  rose lavender dark chocolate -- but the flavor is spot on.   For those that enjoy a fattening custard filled donuts Mr Holmes is the best in the city.   The lemon curd stuffed brioche has no equal.

For the San Francisco donut aficionados Mr Holmes would be of equal quality to Dynamo Donuts with a significant difference in flavor profile.   Glad to hear he is moving close!   $3 a donut, $3.50 a muffin.
author: william c.

description: I can only comment on the croissants. They have some very unique flavors here. I had a salmon one with nori in it and a reuben one. Originally I came in here for a ham and cheese croissant but was told they weren't selling them for the fall season. I admit their croissants are nice and flakey but please make an H&C croissant an all year staple!
author: Steven H.

description: good croissants but no baguettes. they run out of things quickly so get there early
author: Miki P.

description: Unbelievable and worth every moment of standing in line. The best pastries I ever had.
author: Galia S.

description: Unfortunately we didn't get there in time for a cruffin, but the stuffed donut and other stuff was seriously yummy! So do not get discouraged if you don't get a cruffin, the other treats they offer are yummy too!
author: Marie M.

description: Absolutely nothing left, nada, zilch when I came in THREE HOURS before closing time (which is 230 pm). That's just plain unheard of.. 3 hours! These aren't limited edition shoes, the latest apple device, etc.. They sell baked goods. How about throw more "cruffins" in the oven for those who can't line up at 8 in the morning you pretentious .....
author: Bill Z.

description: even before i ate the pastry, they had me with the i got baked in San Francisco sign.  the vanilla custard filled donuts sealed our relationship.
author: Wakako U.

description: Most interesting is the bacon bun.   Otherwise, the rest ok....I've had better.
author: Korene T.

description: I have no idea why people go to this place, pastries are not good. Their sausage croissant (or whatever they call it) is disgusting, very salty and the spice blend they use is so overwhelming. Their mushroom "tart" with whole mushrooms in it? with the thick, hard stems? That's a no-no. Their scones are very dry... I did not try the only thing they are famous for but if what I tried I didn't like, I'm glad I wasn't able to buy it. Added to all of the above, the employees are so full of themselves that they barely pay attention to their customers. I'll stick to b. pattiserie.
author: Anna N.

description: Waited in line for 45m and the sale of cruffins was delayed 15m to 9:15am. I would expect that by baking cruffins daily they would have their routine set and timing perfected, but maybe making the wait longer makes the cruffins more desirable. I was only allowed two salted caramel cruffins (two/person) but could have bought the entire store. They were absolutely wonderful. A combination of caramel on the inside and a buttery croissant shell that just melts in your mouth like nothing else. Ohhh I dream of cruffins every day.
author: Gator D.

description: Pastries are great but man.... The coffee.  Best in the hood.  Staff is great.  I feel like a VIP even when I have to wait in line for a feed. Thanks!
author: Chris S.

description: this place is solid. negative = lines/run out of things but pretty much everything they sell is on point. the bostock things are soooooooo good
author: Carly M.

description:
Here's how your visit is going to go: 

You decide you want a cruffin, because why would you pay ~$5 for a doughnut unless it was something special? You're not going to waste time finding parking or dealing with the line before work, so you pick Saturday. You wake up at whatever time it takes you to get there before 830. It's 830 because they only make one batch of the things 90% of people are there to buy, and a line starts forming around 8 for them. So, as the employees will happily tell you, they "sell out" of cruffins about 30 minutes before they start selling them. Now you wait in line, the first half an hour for them to start selling cruffins, and the next hour and a half (if you're towards the end of the line) to actually get to the counter. The employee will come out to tell you if there's even a slight chance at getting one, but if you're towards the end of the line the only way to find out for sure is to actually wait the hour and a half to see how many cruffins the people in front of you decide to buy. If you miss it, you will only have the exact same 2 hour song and dance to face on Sunday. Also, since the cruffin line is for cruffins ONLY, after that hour and a half you won't even have the option to pay $5 for some other pastry, you will have to go wait in that line first.

So that's my one star. I'm not reviewing the product, they're lovely. I'm reviewing the exploitative, manufactured scarcity BS that they use to sell their product. There is no way to get your hands on the product (on a weekend) in less than 2 hours at 8 in the morning. They don't make more before opening, the don't make a second batch after opening, they don't do any of the things they could do to serve their customers, despite knowing exactly what the demand is.
author: Evan S.

description: Everything we had was delicious but the waiting in line and surly counter help really doesn't make it worth it in the end.  While excellent pastry, etc. there are just as good that don't have a wait line of an hour or more...and if you want a cruffin you have to wait even longer and they don't even start serving them until an hour after they start selling everything else...PLUS if you want items other than Cruffins you have to go back into another line!!!  Ridiculous!!
author: M. Allan P.

description: this bakery has such unique pastries. They are perfect for  gifts or for parties. The cruffins are like no other delight. They are so soft and fluffy. We'd certainly recommend this bakery to friends and relatives, if they want to indulge in delicious desserts.
author: Tish A.

description: The cruffins were delicious. I would agree that they're SF's answer to NYC/Ansel's cronut. It's a shame that the quantity is so limited. I would definitely had purchased more than the 2/person limit. I actually stayed in the line despite the fact they ran out of the coveted stickers several persons before me and lucked out. I also purchased the croissants which were excellent though I'm indifferent to the light sugar glaze treatment. The doughnuts themselves were disappointing, but I enjoyed the fresh taste of the fillings. Given the opportunity, I would return.
author: Jess C.

description: I would have never known of a CRUFFIN, had I not tried an assortment of these delicious pastries.  It's nice to get appreciated by the Boss. And this was a nice way of doing it, tried the passion fruit filled, the banana cream, and the bacon crossaint. Yes I had to splurge!    Couldn't stop pinching off the left over ones.
author: Claudia E.

description: Love the cruffins,we visit the place every time we are in SFO,I just wish they sell cruffins all day long ,last time we almost didn't get any,the cruffins and all the pastries are perfection
author: Celia B.

description: delicious! i'd recommend the California croissant! I wasn't able to try the cruffins :(
author: Cinthia P.

description: while the baked goods i've tried from Mr. Holmes have been good, i've been unable to get my hands on the ever so infamous cruffin. like, i've been to the spot maybe four times super early in the morning to taste it's supposed goodness to zero avail. so FINALLY i needed answers and called in. "yo, can a girl get a cruffin, or nah?" were the exact exaggerated words i didn't use. ha! i just asked what time those suckers come out and why i haven't been able to get them. turns out they come out at just about 9am to a line of people. they used to allow pre-orders but don't anymore. also, a physical person can come and pick up up to 24 pastries but only 2 of which can be cruffins. like, really??? howsabout you guys just make a store full of cruffins for all your cruffinterians and like two other items for whoever isn't on that train? guess i'll have to come back at 9 on the dot one of these days.
author: Regina C.

description:
ORO PRO - in South San Francisco. This is a small plumbing business owned and operated by two brothers. Jonathan the main contact person for the business is so amazing. Very knowledgeable, very responsive, has a deep knowledge of the plumbing products that are out there and able to give sound recommendations. 
Three weeks ago I called on them to fix a clog in one of the toilets in our building. Same day that I called they came to the rescue. Did the work almost at a blink of an eye. He told me then that said toilet needs to be replaced, its old and its flushing mechanism is almost done in. He recommended then what toilet to get when the time comes for us to replace. Today they were back to replace the said toilet. He made the right call and again they were here with all the parts, got the job done in record time with the least amount of disruption and they left the bathroom cleaner than how they found it.
They are now our go-to folks for all our plumbing needs. Give them a call - you will not be sorry because they will not disappoint.
author: Pauline V.

description: The pastries are excellent! Glad to have a real bakery in the neighborhood. Unfortunately it is too popular: around mid-day few kinds are left. Also there was a line outside at 8 AM on a Sunday!
author: Eugene O.

description: Just ok. B.Patisserie is the place for pastries. Not worth the wait if there are long lines.
author: Peter L.

description: Hands down, the best baked items in the city.  Go for the "Cruffin."  Mind-blowing.
author: Geoff E.

description: come early morning, taste their cruffin !!! great ways to start a day, I like.
author: Fama P.

description: The cruffins are pretty good, but it depends on the flavor of the day.  The croissants are good there.  The muffins are really good too.  Stuffed doughnuts are okay.
author: e c.

description: The pastries are as good as all the reviews say. But, if you're not a morning person, forget about it. Sold out by 9am, at the latest. Shame.
author: Tee L.

description: Went here around 2:00PM with my boyfriend and there wasn't much pastries left. The guy behind the counter told us that the more popular items sell out by noon and they've been making more each day, but they still keep selling out! I wasn't upset, though, since we did get there so close to closing. Luckily there was one last Ferrero Rocher choux bomb and I got a pear danish. The guy said it was a similar texture to a cream puff. And it was a bite of heaven! Imagine Ferrero Rocher but so much creamier. I must come back to get more! The pear danish was pretty good too. And the owner gave us an extra danish since we were his last customers of the day. Such a nice guy! And his staff is very nice too! Our cashier suggested that we get there before noon next time so we can see all that they have to offer. As much as I hate getting up early and standing in long lines, I wouldn't mind doing it for Mr. Holmes.
author: Maria C.

description: I absolutely love this bakery. Their crossiants are the best ones I have tasted out of Paris! Although, it's frustrating If you don't go as soon as they open their almost always sold out of everything! Hopefully with all the demanding clients they can start making more batches and also close later as they close at 2:30
author: Ani A.

description: I paid for a course offered online by Americas Real estate and Mortgage schools. Now they claim they no longer offer the course. They never reimbursed the money I paid. The person answering the phones response was not professional claiming she was only a person, (????). With no ability to resolve the problem the only possible conclusion is that they offer little credibility if the website claims it still offers the course. All I could do was send an email for which at this point after my telephone complaint I can expect little.
author: S K.

description: not normally a sweets guy, but I quite enjoyed their baked goods.
author: Chris Y.

description: The Cruffin is good but not sure worth the 1 hr wait.
author: Michael I.

description: I went at 2 on a weekend and there were so little to choose from! I did get an apple cinnamon scone but it just like any other scones I've had.  I would love to try the cruffins but they sell out pretty quick so get there early!
author: Alison H.

description: This place has better than average bake goods. However, all bake goods have sugar in them (except the savory ones), even the normal croissants, Perhaps it is just me, but everything is a little too sweet for me. The line does not go very quickly. I will probably get something here once in a long while when I am in the neighborhood.
author: ZW N.

description: The pastries here are delicious!  I'm glad to find a new bakery that can compete with the likes of B Patisserie and Craftsman and Wolves.  I really like the cruffin and ferrero pate a choux.  Be careful, some of the pastries (especially the powdered ones) can get quite messy though.
author: Josh Q.

description: Yes this place has alot of hype and yes, I totally think it's worth it.  The cruffin is ridiculously flakey and well built considering all of the moist creamy delicious filling.  I think the timing is essential considering it's not something that you want to let get stale or soggy.  The line is honestly pretty random.  Yes, it can wrap around half the block at times but I was very lucky swinging by on a Tuesday morning just after 9:30... the line had just died down to nothing and a fresh tray of cruffins came out!  It's all about time and chance... it's absolutely worth the time if you get the chance.  But even if you miss the rare and illusive cruffin, the other baked goods in uncommon flavors are absolutely delicious and equally flakey and buttery and great to try.  A trip to this bakery will never be wasted time!  From the california croissant made with seaweed and smoked salmon and pickled ginger to the and chocolate and pistachio flavored Kouign-amanns to the fresh filled donuts, there's honestly plenty of other amazing delicacies to enjoy.  Don't get so caught up with the most famous item that you miss all of the other great things that the bake shop has to offer!
author: Angela W.

description: Great bakery with some exceptional pastries. They sell out of some of their most popular sweet treats early. If you are looking for a place to pick up some tasty treats that will in friends, family and clients definitely give this place a try.
author: Rob T.

description: This might be the first ever review -- and five star review -- based on two bite sized samples of baked goods, and I have no idea what could come next of Mr. Holmes, and no idea what he looks like, where he resides, or where his baked goods will end up, but holy goodness the world must know to keep an eye out for them as it seems like they'll be providing baked goods for coffee shops & cafes. There I was minding my own business -- okay maybe I was peeping what was happening behind the barista stand to see this food they were sampling -- at Coffee Cultures as I overheard "some samples came in" from this new bakery. So two bites: 1. A pumpkin bacon spiced quiche. Result: The best thing in my mouth. 2. Giant blueberry chocolate cream muffin situation. Result: the best thing in my mouth. I am not afraid to talk dirty about baked goods, even if these baked goods could be confused with something else considering they're named Mr. Holmes.
author: Jon A.

description: Such a fun experience. I wanted to hug the two guys who worked there. They were adorable, enthusiastic about the goods, and sweet. Got most pastries as a gift for a friend. He immediately hid them so I don't know what his favorites were and I didn't get to try any. Luckily I had separately bought the cruffin which had a fruit flavor that day. I can't remember what kind of fruit but I don't really dig fruit with my pastries. Despite this, I shoved the cruffin down my throat in the car bf I got home. It was really good but I would like to try non fruit in the future. Also got the CA croissant. It was put in a plastic container with the top shut.  By the time I ate it the croissant was mushy. Ewww. Next time I should probably put it in a bag and leave it open part way or just eat the croissant right away. The salmon inside was decent, but even though I love salmon, it wasn't my thing. Want to try their other goodies and will be back!
author: Win S.

description: came here for the first time to get treats for the office. saw a line form and since the place looked small , along with a small counter, I figured protocol is to line up.. so I did. the line didn't move. I stood there and waited... 8 mn to be exact. I finally realized the first two people in line never moved, although it appeared the store was empty. finally said something to the people next to me, and it was then they said I was in line for the cruffins... ?! So OMG I just wasted all that time?  I walked in and proceeded to order but not before I told the gal it as my first time there and perhaps it would make sense to have a sign or something for newbies like myself so they don't line up unnecessarily... Anyway, now I know and I will be back. the pastries and scones I got were delicious. highly recommend (although I never did try the cruffin, not sure I have any interest to)
author: Tina K.

description: the almond poppy seed bread isn't getting nearly the recognition it should.
author: around town e.
